loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Gloria is 56 years old now.

Gloria has a tailoring business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials needed like garments, etc.

Gloria has been in this business for four years. In the future, Gloria would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials needed like garments, etc.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Leonora is 30 years old and three of her children are in school.

Leonora has a fish vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish and other supplies for her business.

Leonora has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Leonora would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish and other supplies

loans.name: Balbina

texts.en:
Balbina is 41,a married woman with four children, who are attending school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Balbina has a welding shop business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more metals and welding supplies.

Balbina has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Balbina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more metals and welding supplies for her business in order to save for her children to go to college

loans.name: Mary Hope

texts.en:
Mary Hope is 29 years old, a married woman with one child is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Mary Hope has a food vending business in the Philippines. Mary Hope requested a PHP 11000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

Mary Hope has been in this business for three years. In the future, Mary Hope would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-vending business, which she hopes to expand using profits

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is 39 years old and married with two children.

Estrella works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Estrella has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from frozen foods.

Estrella aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell so as to be able to continue sending her children to school

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 41 years old and has three children who are in school.

Virginia is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Virginia requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.  Virginia has been in this business for 3 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future, Virginia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock so as to able to afford a college education for her children

loans.name: Florenda

texts.en:
Florenda works hard to support her family. Florenda is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in the market.

Florenda has been in this business for 7 years now.

In the future, Florenda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in the market for the future college education of her children

loans.name: Josephine

Josephine has requested a PHP 23000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items such as canned goods, soft-drinks, diapers, etc. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like canned goods, soft-drinks, diapers, etc.

loans.name: Kisslen

She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional spare parts to sell for her business.

Kisslen has been in this business for 4 years now.

In the future, Kisslen would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional spare motorcycle parts to sell for her business.

loans.name: Luvizminda

texts.en:
Luvizminda is married and works hard to support her family. Luvizminda has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Luvizminda requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Luvizminda has been in this business for 10 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en:
Aurelia is a married woman. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Aurelia is 44 years old now.

Aurelia has a food vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Aurelia has been in this business for 17 years. In the future, Aurelia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for preparing the foods she will sell

loans.name: Jeanie

texts.en:
As a married parent of one children, Jeanie works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Jeanie is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase more sacks of rice to sell in her stall.

Jeanie has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice to sell in her stall

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 52 years old and married with seven children. With one child in school, Teresita works very hard to provide for them.

Teresita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, cigarettes, personal care products, and other groceries. Teresita has been in this business for six years now. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future, Teresita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, cigarettes, personal care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Lurdes

texts.es: Lurdes tiene un micromercado donde vende abarrotes lácteos, verduras y embutidos etc. que se encuentra ubicado en un municipio de Cundinamarca. Su negocio inició hace 20 años, cuando procedente de su tierra natal, se dio cuenta que no existía tienda cercana y decidió aprovechar este vacío comercial,  para generar ingresos ubicando a un lado contiguo de su vivienda, en un local, su venta de  Verduras, abarrotes, lácteos,  entre otros artículos,  que rotan permanentemente en el negocio de Lurdes, y que genera la necesidad de tener inventarios consistentes, para impactar la decisión de compra de su clientela pues en la medida en que el cliente encuentre todo lo que necesite su decisión de regresar no se hace esperar. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará estos productos, para vender más y genera ingresos adicionales, que lo encausen hacia su estabilidad económica y una mejor calidad de vida, asi mismo requiere hacer adecuaciones a su local con el cual mejorar la imagen del negocio y proporcionar comodidad en su tarea diaria. Mientras esto ocurre Lurdes trabaja desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 9:30 de la noche sin cesar, con el fin de cumplir sus obligaciones financieras y genera bienestar a su familia conformada por su cónyuge y su hija de 26 años de edad.
texts.en:
Lurdes has a mini-market where she sells groceries, dairy products, vegetables, sausages, etc.  It is located in the town of Cundinamarca.  She started her business 20 years ago.  When she came from her native land, she realized there was no store nearby and she decided to take advantage of a commercial space in order to generate income.  This space is located on an adjacent side of her home in a business site.  Her sale of vegetables, groceries, dairy products, and other items that she permanently rotates in her business generates the need to have consistent inventory in order to have an impact on her customers' buying decisions.  In the event that her customers find everything they need, their decision to return is not expected.

This is the reason why Lurdes turns to a Kiva loan and gets her first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  With this she will buy these items in order to sell more and generate additional income.  This will bring about financial stability and a better quality of life.  At the same time, she needs to make adaptations to her location by improving the image of her business and providing comfort in her daily work.  Lurdes works from 8:00 in the morning to 9:30 at night without stopping. Her goal is to fulfill her financial obligations and to create well-being for her family, which is made up of her husband and her 26-year-old daughter.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, groceries, and dairy products among other items.

loans.name: Erkeaiym

texts.ru: Эркеайым, 32 года, замужем. У нее высшее образование, уже 10 лет в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, она занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду, в хозяйстве Эркеайым на сегодняшний день имеется 12 коров, 30 овец. На 1,20 Га земли выращивает картофель и люцерну. В целях увеличения своего бизнеса Эркеайым обратилась в Банк «Бай–Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Erkeaiym is 32 years old and married.  She has a college education. For the past ten years, she has been involved in animal husbandry and agriculture, two activities which constitute her family's main source of income.  Thanks to her very hard work, she currently has 12 cows and 30 sheep on her farm.  She also grows potatoes and alfalfa on 1.2 hectares of land.  In order to increase her business, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 30,000 som (KGS) to buy livestock.  She is planning to reinvest the earnings from her loan into further increasing her number of domestic animals.

loans.use: to purchase some livestock and increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Arcel

texts.en:

Arcel has a firewood sales business in the Philippines. Arcel requested a PHP 8000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of firewood to sell.

Arcel has been in this business for three years. In the future, Arcel would like to save enough money to expand her business and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of firewood to sell and improve the quality of her life

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from farming rice. Haide is borrowing PHP 25000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Haide has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell, to save money for sending her children to college

loans.name: Linda

Jennelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell at her food stall. She will use the profits to expand her business

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Norma

Norma has been in this business for 16 years. In the future, Norma would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal to resell.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

Lilia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.name: Ludivina

Ludivina works hard to support her family. Ludivina is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in the market.

In the future, Ludivina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

Merly has been in this business for 6 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more bamboo to sell

loans.name: Lucena

Lucena is 66 years old and married with 2 children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22000 loan through NWTF to buy products to sell such as canned goods, eggs, noodles, sugar, coffee, etc.

Lucena has been in this business for 40 years. 

In the future Lucena would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's financial stability.

loans.use: to buy products to sell such as canned goods, eggs, noodles, sugar, and coffee.

loans.name: Brenda Beatriz

texts.es:
Brenda, está mejorando el negocio de venta de tortillas, sus clientes han aumentado y tiene nuevas ganancias, que son de ayuda para disminuir las necesidades de su hogar, nuevamente se acompañado con el padre de sus hijo y le ha apoyado para poder tener herramientas con las que desempeña su oficio de electricista.
En vista de la llegada del invierno necesita de un crédito para comprar leña, cal y maíz, abastecerá de materia prima su inventario para no quedarse sin trabajar en esta temporada y seguir teniendo clientes satisfechos.
texts.en:
Brenda is improving her tortilla selling business, as both her customer base and earnings have grown. This helps her care for her household, and now that she is living with the father of her children she has helped supply him with tools for his work as an electrician.

Since winter is coming, she needs a loan to buy firewood, lime, and corn, stocking up her inventory so that she doesn't run out of work over the winter and so her customers stay satisfied.

loans.use: to buy firewood, lime, and corn, stocking up her inventory so that she doesn't run out of work over the winter.

Flerida has been in this business for 7 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.name: Rosalie

In the future, Rosalie would like to save enough to provide her family with a secure future.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is a married woman with three children, one of whom is in school. She is 50 years old and a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Leonida has a business in the Philippines buying and selling new clothes, and she requested a PHP 19000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items to sell like underwear, sleepwear, and other items.

Leonida has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like underwear, sleepwear, and other items.

loans.name: Lorie

texts.en:

Mhayett has been in this business for 10 years.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, coffee and personal care products and expand her store for the benefit of her family

loans.name: Helen

She has a buy and sell fishing supplies/materials business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing. Helen is borrowing PHP 25000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like cement, fishing nets, and other supplies for her business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Helen has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of fishing materials to sell to secure the future of her family

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 59 years old, married with ten children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Virginia has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Virginia requested a PHP 14000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

Virginia has been in this business for 13 years. In the future, Virginia would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall to use the profits to expand her stall and business

loans.name: Ma. Cristina

texts.en:
Ma. Cristina, 42, is a married woman with three children who are at school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Ma. Cristina  has a food vending business in the Philippines. Ma. Cristina  requested a PHP 6000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Ma. Cristina  has been in this business for 5 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business to save to send her children to college

loans.name: Emely

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Emely works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from vegetable vending. Emely is borrowing PHP 11000 through NWTF to buy more boxes of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Emely has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of fish to sell to provide a secure future for her family

loans.name: Eleonor

texts.en:
Eleonor is 45 years old, married with four children. Three of her children are still in school.

Eleonor works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Eleonor has borrowed and paid 27 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 25 years and also earns an income from clothing sales and restaurant businesses.

Eleonor aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.and therefore build and expand her business

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 36 years old, married with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell .

Rosita has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from fish vending.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell and thus have funds to expand her business

loans.name: Gulmira

texts.ru: Гулмира, 29 лет, замужем, мать 2 детей. Образование у Гулмиры среднее, вместе с супругом они занимаются животноводством и полеводством уже 3 года. По характеру она очень приятная и жизнерадостная и трудолюбивая женщина. В хозяйстве есть 2 коровы, на 0,40 Га собственной земли Гулмира выращивает картофель для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации оптовым покупателям, есть сад. Гулмира решила развить свою деятельность. Для этого она обратилась в Банк «Бай - Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку семян картофеля для выращивания органической продукции. На прибыль от кредита Гулмира планирует и дальше развивать ее деятельность, чтобы накопить на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Gulmira is 29 years old, married, and the mother of two children.  She has a secondary education.  For three years already, she and her husband have been involved in animal husbandry and agriculture.  Gulmira is very good-natured, cheerful and hardworking.  She has two cows on her farm.  On 0.4 hectares of her own land, she also grows potatoes for domestic consumption on the farm and for resale to wholesale buyers.  She also has an orchard.  Gulmira has decided to develop her activity, and for this reason, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy seed potatoes in order to grow organic crops.  Gulmira is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further develop her activity, so that she can save enough money to repair her house.

loans.use: to buy seed potatoes in order to grow organic vegetables.

loans.name: Hyline

texts.en:
Hyline is 37 years old, married and blessed with 4 children. She has been a farmer for the last 8 years. 

She will use the loan to purchase farm inputs such as seeds, fertilizer and manure so as to get a better harvest to sell and hopes this will enable her to meet her family's needs. 

She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children and in future she hopes to expand her farming business and be successful.

loans.use: To purchase farm input for use in her farm and get more farm produce for sale to enable her to support and educate her family.

loans.name: Zeny

texts.en:
Zeny, 46,  is a married woman with six children, with three of still in school. She is a very hard  working entrepreneur. 

Zeny has a chicken business in the Philippines. Zeny requested a PHP 6000 loan amount through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her chickens.

Zeny has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her chickens and be able to save to send her children to college

loans.name: Dinara

texts.ru: Динара, 38 лет, замужем, 2 детей- школьников. Семья очень дружная и уважаемая в селе. Динара 15 лет занимается животноводством. На сегодняшний день она успешный фермер своего небольшого хозяйства, в котором у нее имеется: 2 коровы, 15 овец, 3 лошади. Ежемесячная прибыль составляет до 20,000 сом (KGS). Всю прибыль от бизнеса Динара старается вкладывать в развитие бизнеса. Она обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом, в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для откорма и перепродажи. Динара хочет и дальше развивать ее бизнес.
texts.en: Dinara is 38 years old, married, and the mother of two school-aged children. Dinara's family is very friendly and well respected in the village.  Dinara has been involved in animal husbandry for 15 years.  Today, she is a successful farmer and she owns two cows, 15 sheep and three horses.  She makes a monthly income of up to 20,000 som (KGS).  She tries to invest all the profits from her business into further developing her activity.  She has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy sheep for fattening and resale.  She wants to further grow her business.

loans.use: to buy some sheep for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Yvonne

texts.en:
Yvonne works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

Yvonne has been in this business for 17 years now.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Flordeliza is 52 years old and has one child who is in school.

Flordeliza has a general store business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries like canned goods, noodles, soft drinks, and other groceries.

She has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries like canned goods, noodles, soft drinks, and other groceries

loans.name: Madinah School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Ishamaca. He is the Head teacher of Madinah Islamic School, a mixed school in the Urban area of Nsangi in Wakiso 900 students. 

Madinah School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining two UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase two UV water treatment systems with two 450 litre tanks, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Madinah School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Ishamaca ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 36 years old, married and has four children, three of whom are in school. 

Corazon is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Corazon requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Corazon has been in this business for 6 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Corazon would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock and to save money for sending her children to college later on

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 51 years old and has six children. She is married and has one child who is in school.

Merlinda is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

She has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Merlinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Fanny

texts.en:
Fanny is 24 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as diapers, canned goods, soft drinks, and other personal care products. 

In the future Fanny would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Clarinda

texts.en:
Clarinda is 55 years old, married with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Clarinda has a general store business in the Philippines. Clarinda requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Clarinda has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Clarinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Donalyn

texts.en:
Donalyn is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Donalyn is 25 years old and one of her children is still in school.

Donalyn has a buy-and-sell dried fish business in the Philippines. Donalyn requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more dried fish to sell.

Donalyn has been in this business for five years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Argie

texts.en:
Argie is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur; she is 33 years old and all of her children are in school.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more items like canned goods, personal care products ,and other groceries.

Argie has been in this business for 14 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more items like canned goods, personal care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Evelyn Yazaira

texts.es:
Evelyn, ella es madre soltera  de un niño menor de edad, trabaja muy duro para cubrir todas las necesidades de su hogar, su actividad económica principal es la venta de antojitos como enchiladas, tostadas, yuca frita, etc., también posee una pequeña tienda en la que ofrece a sus vecinos artículos de primera necesidad y el negocio está funcionando desde hace más de cinco años.
Solicita ayuda con un crédito que utilizara para comprar aceite, plátano, harina, yuca, maíz, leña y condimentos para seguir elaborando los antojitos, podrá contar con la materia prima para mantenerse trabajando sin problemas, espera poder recuperar la inversión con un mayor margen de ganancias.
Sus aspiraciones son darle a su hijo una vida más digna y ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Evelyn is a single mother with a young son. She works very hard to cover their household needs and her primary source of income is the sale of street food, such as enchiladas, tostadas, and fried cassava. She also owns a small store where she offers basic necessities to her neighbors, and has been running this business for over 5 years.

Evelyn is requesting a loan to buy oil, plantains, flour, cassava, firewood, and condiments in order to keep producing street food. She can depend on these basic materials to keep her in business with no problems, and she hopes to be able to recover the investment by a great margin. Her aspiration is to give her son a more decent life and to pay the bills on time.

loans.use: to buy oil, plantains, flour, cassava, firewood, and condiments in order to keep producing street food.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to diversify into growing cereals for resale, for the benefit of her child and family

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet lives on a hilltop in Chuka, Kenya with her children. From her small wood house she can see light at the end of the tunnel, thanks to the income she earns through practicing mixed farming. 

Harriet passionately loves dairy farming. Because of her immense farming knowledge she commands a lot of respect from other farmers. The biggest challenge she faces is satisfying the demand for milk in her village. The demand is overwhelming. 

She is seeking a loan to buy another dairy cow. She believes that through the loan she will be able to improve her living conditions and be able to secure the future of her family. She has gone through training with Juhudi Kilimo, and she is confident that the skills she acquired will help her increase her business and be able to pay back the loan. Harriet is confident that if you invest in her dream, you will be impacting the life of her family.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow, to make a dramatic impact on the improvement of her family's life

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace, 38, is a mother who has been running a small-scale mixed farm in Kenya for two years. Her primary income sources are maize, vegetables, and profits from a small-time personal business. 

Grace is seeking a loan to purchase modern farming implements. She realized that she is working increasingly longer and harder on her farm. 

The farm work women in the area are currently doing was previously done by males. Women have been forced to take over as their husbands migrate to find wage labor in urban areas. 

Therefore, the tools women use are of great importance for improving productivity and yields, and reducing time and physical effort. There are health implications as well from using poor traditional tools. 

The increased income from the use of better tools will help her meet business-related expenses. When asked, "How will this loan benefit your family?" Grace replied, "I will be able to educate my children."

loans.use: To purchase farm implements

loans.name: Juan Gabriel

texts.es:
Juan, es casado, junto a su esposa ha procreado un hijo que tiene 5 años de edad, él tiene la responsabilidad de cubrir todos los gastos familiares; administra un taller mecánico desde hace tres años, trabaja todos los días y tiene un empelado para atender a sus clientes, el oficio lo aprendió cuando trabajaba en otro taller.
Invertirá en un juego de llaves, luces, cables, aceite, bujías, etc., y realizará mejoras en el local del negocio, surtirá mejor el inventario para tener lo necesario al momento que sus cliente necesiten de  sus servicios, espera que la afluencia de clientes cada vez sea mayor para que sus ingresos aumenten y ser puntual con el pago de su deuda.
Sus objetivos son ir ampliando su negocio poco a poco y tener una mejor situación financiera.
texts.en:
Juan is married and, along with his wife, has fathered a son who is 5 years old.  He is in charge of covering all of the family expenses.  

He has managed a garage for the past three years, and works every day.  He has one employee who helps him with customers.  He learned the trade while working at another garage shop.

He will invest in a set of wrenches,  keys, lights, cables, oil, spark plugs, etc., and make improvements on the business locale.  He will have better inventory so as to be able to have all that is needed at the moment that his clients need his services.  He expects the influx of customers to increase so that his income increases and thus be able to remain punctual with loan payments.  

His goals are to expand his business bit by bit, and so be able to attain a better financial situation.

loans.use: to invest in a set of wrenches, lights, cables, oil, spark plugs, etc., and make improvements on the business locale.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 47 years old, married with three children.

Evangeline works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy items to sell in her store, like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

Evangeline has borrowed and paid 24 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 22 years and also earns an income from farming vegetables.

Evangeline aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her store, like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en:
Rufina is a 50-year-old married woman with six children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur who has a nipa roofing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 3 years, and has requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy nipa leaves and bamboo sticks.

In the future, Rufina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy nipa leaves and bamboo sticks

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell.

Rosario has been in this business for 8 years now. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Florema

texts.en:
Florema works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Florema has been in this business for 3 years now. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Juliesta

texts.en:
Juliesta, 34, is a smallholder mixed-farmer from Rukinda village which is found in the central province of Kenya. This is her tenth year in marriage with Dennis and together they have two children. 

Juliesta runs a 0.5 acre farmland with 1 dairy cow, 23 heads of poultry, 150 trees, and a garden filled with maize/corn plants. To make extra on the side, Juliesta also runs a cereal trade shop which has proved to be so lucrative that she is focused on expanding it. 

Juliesta is seeking a loan to invest in her cereal business. Your money will be used to aggregate cereal produce from other farmers in order to build inventory while the cereal circulation in the market is high and prices low. 

Juliesta will use her dairy income to make initial loan repayments until she starts supplying cereals when prices are high.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 46 years old, married with two children.

Josephine works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy items like canned goods, personal care products, etc., to sell in her store.

Josephine has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 25 years and also earns an income from farming rice and raising livestock.

Josephine aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items like canned goods, personal care products, etc., to sell in her store.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Hello lenders. Meet Joseph, who is very ambitious and always jovial. 

For a living, Joseph cultivates crops and keeps dairy animals. His main sources of income are milk and produce sales. 

Joseph is actively seeking to expand his farm by buying more land. With this loan, Joseph will pay for labor and inputs to cultivate more land and plant more maize and other crops. 

At the end of the season, the additional income Joseph makes from this investment would help to keep expanding his business and improving his family's livelihood.

loans.use: To buy more land and expand his farming

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Regardless of the great impact that agriculture has on the Kenyan economy, micro-finance institutions (M.F.I.'s) view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition. Juhudi Kilimo is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Kenyan farmers. 

Meet Martin, an ever-smiling, hardworking, and honest father who is 38 years of age. He hails from the Chuka area of Kenya. He is the proud father of two lovely children. He loves and treasures his children and will go the extra mile to make sure that they are comfortable. 

Martin’s primary source of income has come from selling milk, crop farming, and poultry farming. Through these ventures he has been able to earn a decent income. He is a very determined and dedicated farmer who has been farming for 21 years, and throughout, he has never regretted going into farming. 

Although this humble dad has been making profits, not everything has been “a bed of roses." He faces financial challenges, and because the Chuka area has proven a ready market for cereals, he is kindly seeking a loan to buy cereals for re-sale and thus improve his income. 

Martin’s upbringing was challenging, and he has faced many economic problems. Still, this ever-smiling dad has been making great improvements, and he believes that through your loan he will be able to realize his goal of improving his living conditions and transforming his life. 

Through Juhudi Kilimo, Martin has received training and he has proven to be honest and disciplined with finances. He intends to fully repay the loan with the profits from his business. Martin is quite visionary and - with his accumulated profits - hopes he will be able to open a large cereal-selling shop that will boost his income and turn his life around.

loans.use: To buy cereals for re-sale.

loans.name: Inilda

texts.es: Inilda de 61 años, es una mujer comerciante, que ofrece mercancías variadas mediante guías especializadas o catálogos, ofreciendo a su clientela las mejores opciones de compra relacionada especialmente con promociones de productos que llegan con descuentos especiales en cada temporada. Ella tiene 5 años de haber iniciado su negocio, impulsada por una amiga que la orientó para lograrlo. Ropa calzado, accesorios femeninos conforman los artículos de su oferta, los cuales vende a crédito para que su clientela le pague durante el periodo correspondiente a dos quincenas.  Sus vecinos y familiares son los clientes principales de Inilda, con los cuales espera impulsar su esquema de referídos, con el fin de ser líder de grupo y generar mayores ingresos. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará ropa, perfumes, accesorios femeninos etc. Con esta inversión dará respuesta a los pedidos de sus clientela y con ello generará nuevos ingresos que harán de su credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en:
Inilda is 61 years old. She is a vendor who sells a variety of merchandise through specialized guides and catalogs. She offers her customers the best purchasing options, especially with regards to promotions and products that come with special discounts each season. She started her business 5 years ago after being urged by a friend who helped her establish it.

Clothing, shoes, and accessories for women are included in the inventory that she offers, which she sells on credit so that her customers can pay her every 15 days. Inilda's main customers are her neighbors and family members, and she hopes that they will boost her referral network. Her goal is to be the leader of the group and to earn a higher income.

Currently, she is seeking a CrediKiva, which is the first loan that she requests from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use it to buy clothing, perfumes, accessories for women, etc. With this loan, she will fulfill orders from her customers and generate new earnings, making her CrediKiva a successful investment.

loans.use: to buy clothing, perfumes, accessories for women, etc.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is 29 years old and married with four children. With three children in school, Jessica works very hard to provide for them.

Jessica runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal product care, beverages, and other groceries.

Jessica has been in this business for 5 years now. 

In the future, Jessica would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal product care, beverages, and other groceries to help pay later for college fees

loans.name: Benevictoria

texts.en:
Benevictoria is 44 years old, married and has four children.

Benevictoria is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Benevictoria requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Benevictoria has been farming vegetables for 23 years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Benevictoria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is 49 years old and has nine children. She is married and six of her children are in school.

Flora is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Flora requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Flora has been farming vegetables for 29 years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Flora would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional fish materials, like fishing net, gasoline for her boat, and other items for her business.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine, 53, is a woman with four children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Josephine has a food vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Josephine has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Josephine would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business and provide a secure future for her family

loans.name: Babylyn

texts.en:
Babylyn is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with one child.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like food vending.

Babylyn dreams that one day she will be able to save enough to provide a secure future for her family

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell and provide for a secure future

loans.name: Dioleza

texts.en:
Dioleza is a 40 year old married woman with six children, three of whom are still in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Dioleza has a buy and sell dried fish business in the Philippines. Dioleza requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more dried fish to sell.

Dioleza has been in this business for 2 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish to sell and save money for her kids to go to college

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
Lea is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lea is 47 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Lea has a fruit vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fruits to sell.

Lea has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Lea would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell and plan for her children's future

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Judith works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. Judith is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies for her fishing business.

Judith has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies

loans.name: Angelie

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Angelie works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Angelie is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-production business.

Angelie has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-production business.

loans.name: Norma Orbelinda

texts.es: Norma, tiene 31 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijas y reside con ellas en un sector que pertenece a Villanueva, Cortes. Ella trabajó por varios años en una maquila y al quedar sin empleo decidió por su propio negocio, lleva tres años de comprar y vender puertas de madera. El negocio lo tiene instalado en un local que alquila. Esta actividad es su fuente de ingresos para la familia. Ella solicita un préstamo por 8,000 lempiras para comprar mas puertas y vender ya que esta teniendo demanda y necesita tener inventario. Su plan es hacer crecer el negocio para que sus hijas se superen.
texts.en:
Norma is 31 years old and a single mother. She has two daughters, and lives with them in a sector of Villanueva, Cortes. She worked for several years in a textile factory, and after becoming unemployed she decided to start her own business. She has been buying and selling wooden doors for the last three years.  

She operates her business from a space that she rents, and it is her source of income for the family. She is seeking a loan of 8,000 lempiras to buy more doors to sell, since the demand for them has increased, and she needs the inventory. Her plan is to grow the business so that her daughters may get ahead.

loans.use: to buy wooden doors to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional materials for her business like fishing net, gasoline for her boat and other items.

loans.name: Rolando Gerardo

texts.es: Rolando Gerardo, tiene la edad  de 46 años, está casado,  vive con su esposa y su hija los cuales su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de semilla de frijol y de fertilizantes y otros productos para aplicarle a la siembra y en el desarrollo del cultivo, además pagar mano de obra para la aplicación de los productos y asistencia de la plantación una vez que tenga desarrollo, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones que cuenta la zona para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo de granos básicos. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad al igual que una cosecha adecuada, y tener a corto plazo una producción importante. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en el bienestar y estudio de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos eshtatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Rolando Gerardo is 46 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and his daughter, who are his main priority in life. 

With his loan he plans to buy bean seed, fertilizers, and other products to apply to the crop as it grows. He will also pay for labor to apply the products and for maintenance once the crop grows. In this way he will be sure that a good job is done. He intends to take advantage of the good conditions that exist in the area for the growth of this crop, and also to put to work the several years’ worth of experience that he has in managing the cultivation of basic grains. He will be able to buy the best quality products so that his crop will grow well and be healthy and give a good harvest. In the short term, his production will be important. 

He plans to use the income from the good harvest that he expects to have for the wellbeing of his family and their studies. He will also take care of some family goals and continue investing in the crops. This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. He hasn’t had previous loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has granted him this loan with better repayment terms and much lower interest.

loans.use: to plant beans.

loans.name: Ana Marisela

texts.es:
Ana, se dedica a cultivar maíz, la cosecha la utiliza para alimentar su núcleo familiar y comercializar otra parte para tener recursos económicos, con los que cubre otros compromisos, lo práctica desde hace 20 años; vive con sus hijos, está separada de su esposo, sus hijos son profesionales y trabajan además le apoyan económicamente.
Comprará fertilizantes, semilla, abono e insecticidas, para tener todo lo necesario y sembrar en el tiempo indicado, espera aumentar su producción y obtener recursos necesarios para cubrir las necesidades familiares y resarcir su deuda.
Sus sueños son tener un área de cultivo mucho más grande y ser reconocida en su localidad.
texts.en:
Ana farms corn. She uses the harvest to feed her family and sells part of it for income, which she uses to cover other expenses. She has been doing this for 20 years. She lives with her children. She is separated from her husband. Her children are professionals and work; they also help her out economically.

She will buy fertilizers, seed, manure, and insecticides in order to have everything she needs to plant at the right time. She hopes to increase her production and make the profits needed to cover the family’s necessities and repay her debt.

Her dreams are to have a much larger area to plant and to be recognized in her town.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seed, manure, and insecticides in order to have everything she needs to plant at the appropriate time.

loans.name: Carlos Enrique

texts.es:
Carlos es un hombre de 30 años de edad, es casado tiene un hermoso hijo que vive aún  bajo su cuidado. Ellos viven en una comunidad de Suchitepéquez.

Carlos con el afán de obtener sus ingresos y mantener a su familia se dedica a la albañilería desde hace cinco años, gracias a esta labor ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia.
Carlos gracias al empeño con el que realiza su labor, tiene mucha gente que solicita de sus servicios, pero él no cuenta con las suficientes herramientas es por ello que ahora, está solicitando un préstamo porque necesita comprar una cortadora de piso cerámico, pues esta herramienta es fundamental para su trabajo.
El gran sueño de Carlos es ser un gran maestro de obra para mejorar sus ingresos y así también la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Carlos is 30 years old. He is married and has a wonderful son who still lives in his care. They live in the community of Suchitepéquez.

Carlos, with the goal of earning an income and taking care of his family, has worked in construction for the past five years. Thanks to this work, he has been able to provide for his family. 

Thanks to the determination with which Carlos does his work, he has many people who request his services. But he doesn’t have enough tools. This is why he is requesting a loan, because he needs to buy a tile cutting saw. This tool is fundamental to his work.

Carlos’ greatest dream is to be a great master of his work, in order to improve his income and therefore his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a tile cutting saw.

She has a clothing sales business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from rice retailing. Nimfa is borrowing PHP 5000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of clothes to sell to customers.

Nimfa has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es:
Manuel, de 32 años de edad estudio hasta tercer grado, por falta de recursos económicos no continuo sus estudios y opto por trabajar desde muy temprana edad, ahora está acompañado y tiene tres hijos, los cuales asisten a la escuela.

Manuel, es agricultor en pequeño, se ha dedicado a esta labor desde que abandono la escuela a los 10 años, aprendió a sembrar diferentes tipos de cultivos con la ayuda de sus padres, luego aprendió a manejar camiones de carga, con los que halan caña de azúcar; hoy en día trabaja para otras personas viajando de un departamento a otro, cuando el viaja su esposa cuida de los cultivos y cuida de sus hijos.

Manuel, necesita el préstamo para comprar 6 sacos de fertilizante y pagar el arrendamiento del terreno donde sembrará.

Los sueños de Manuel, es tener su propio camión y también poder ayudarle a sus hijos para que estudien.
texts.en:
Manuel is 32 years old. He studied through the third grade. Due to a lack of economic resources, he didn’t continue his studies and chose to work from a very early age. He now lives with his partner and has three children, all of whom are in school.

Manuel is a small farmer. He has been in this line of work since leaving school at the age of 10 years old. He learned to plant the different kinds of crops with his parents’ help. Later he learned to drive cargo trucks, which are used to haul sugar cane. He now works for other people, traveling from one department to another. When he travels, his wife takes care of the crops and their children. 

Manuel needs the loan to buy 6 sacks of fertilizer and to pay the rent for the land where he will plant.

Manuel’s dreams are to have his own truck and also to be able to help his children so they can study.

loans.use: to buy 6 sacks of fertilizer and to pay the rent for the land where he will plant.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a family man and a farmer from the Bomet area of Kenya. He started a family with Emmy, his spouse, 14 years ago and today they have four children. Paul has spent the last 15 years of his life doing farming. His main source of income through the years has been milk. In spite of being involved in other income-generating activities such as poultry, horticulture and tree planting, Paul's keen interest is focused on dairy farming.

In order to grow his dairy farm to greater heights, Paul's strategy is not only to increase the number of animals on his farm, but to ensure that the additional cows are something of pedigree quality. Paul's biggest challenge, until now, was finding a financier willing to loan him an amount sufficient to settle the steep price of a high-quality cow.  

Paul is seeking a loan to buy a high quality dairy cow. With your loan, the newly-acquired dairy cow will have a big impact on Paul's life. His family will enjoy the prestige of running a highly-productive dairy business. Their business will thrive and their future calves will fetch a fortune for them since they'll have inherited desirable-quality traits from their parents. This investment will provide Paul and his family with an opportunity to change their lives and their livelihoods forever.

loans.use: to buy a high-quality dairy cow

María tiene 2 negocio la crianza de animales menores y la venta de papas asadas que lo realiza todas las tardes. María comenta que ella no tuvo el apoyo del padre de sus hijos y que por medio de sus negocio es que saco Adelante a sus hijos. María solicita el dinero del credito para invertirlo en la compra de pollos que los cria en pequeños corrales. A María le gustaria seguir mejorando su negocio de crianza de pollos y de esta manera seguir cubriendo sus gastos y con lo poco  que tiene ayudar a sus nietos.
texts.en: Fifty-two year old Maria is a hardworking woman. Maria has 5 children who are already adults. She lives in a rented house with a son and two grandchildren. Maria has the business of raising small animals and selling baked potatoes in the afternoons. Maria comments that she did not have the support of the father of her children, and that she was able to move her children forward thanks to her businesses. Maria is requesting a loan to invest in buying chickens that she grows in small corrals. Maria would like to continue improving her business of raising chickens, and in this way to continue covering her expenses; and with the little she has, to help her grandchildren.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Carlos Gerardo

texts.es: Carlos Gerardo, tiene la edad  de 19 años, está soltero,  vive con sus padres y hermanos, los cuales su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de semilla de frijol de buena calidad y que se adapte bien a las condiciones de la zona y de fertilizantes y otros productos para aplicarle a la siembra y en el desarrollo del cultivo, además pagar mano de obra para la aplicación de los productos y asistencia de la plantación una vez que tenga desarrollo, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones que cuenta la zona para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo de granos básicos. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad al igual que una cosecha adecuada, y tener a corto plazo una producción importante. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en el bienestar y estudio de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos eshtatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Carlos Gerardo is 19 years old, single, and lives with his parents and siblings who are his biggest priority.  With the loan, he intends to purchase high quality bean seeds that adapt well to the conditions of the area, as well as fertilizers and other products to apply to the planting and development of the crop.  Additionally, he will pay for the labor to apply the products and help with the planting once there is work, and thus make sure to do a good job.  

What he intends to do is take advantage of the good conditions they have in the area for this crop and also to put into practice his several years of experience in the handling of basic grains.  In addition to being able to buy better quality products so that his plants have good growth and health, he will have an adequate harvest and get a considerable production in the short-term.  With the income from the harvest that he hopes to get, he will use it for the well-being and education of his family, to complete some family goals, and to invest further in the crops.  

This is the first loan that he has received from FUDECOSUR.  He has not had any previous loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered him the loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to plant beans.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
Hello lenders, meet John. He is a 39-year-old farmer from the Ndaragwa area of Kenya who practices both dairy and horticulture farming. His family consists of himself, his wife and four children aged between 7 and 18 years. His main income sources are milk and crop produce. He also has 50 trees on the farm that will generate income at the right time in the future. 

John is planning to plant more crops on his five-acre piece of land this year. He is seeking a loan investment from Kiva lenders to purchase farm inputs. He needs your support because of the seasonal and unpredictable nature of farm produce. Farmers can invest their money in crops and wind up not making any profit due to many factors in the external environment. When such a situation happens, they need support from financial institutions to continue running the following season. 

With your loan, John will be able to fertilize his farm and plant quality seedlings from an authorized dealer in Ndaragwa. He will use income from milk sales to make initial loan repayments until the crops are ready for harvest. This loan will have a positive impact on John's family's livelihood.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Yessenia Marisela

texts.es:

Marisela, tiene una tienda y se ha dedicado a este negocio desde hace tres años, anteriormente ella hacia tortillas, pero decidió obtener un crédito y pudo colocar la tienda y así empezó con su negocio, pero siempre vende tortillas en la comunidad, la tienda la tiene en su casa y su hija cuando no esta en la escuela, le ayuda a atenderla; su horario es desde las 8:00 a.m. hasta que se termina la venta tipo 4:05 p.m.

Marisela, necesita el crédito para comprar azúcar, frijoles, arroz, café y también frutas para refrescos.

Ella sueña con que su hija pueda tener su propio negocio y mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Marisela, 28, studied until 6th grade. She is married and her husband is a farmer. They have two children, ages 2 and 14. Her older daughter is in school.

Marisela has worked at her store for three years; prior to that, she made tortillas. She decided to get a loan and was able to install her store, which is how her business began. She also still sells tortillas. The store is in her home, and her daughter helps work there when she's not in school. The store is open from 8am until sales are over, around 4 or 5 pm.

Marisela needs this loan to buy sugar, beans, rice, coffee, and fruits to make juices. Her dream is that her daughter will be able to have her own business and improve her home.

loans.use: to buy sugar, beans, rice, coffee, and fruits to make juices.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wood.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is 31 years old, with two children. She works very hard to provide for them. Joan runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like noodles, beverages, home product care and other groceries.

Joan has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as noodles, coffee, beverages, pancit, soap, bread and other groceries. In the future, Joan would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like noodles, beverages, home product care and other groceries.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, brick, iron, a terminal box, electrical cables, and sockets to install electricity and to construct a rammed earth wall.

loans.name: Romelyn

texts.en:
Romelyn is 40 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Romelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. She has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap and other groceries. 

In the future Romelyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia is a married woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Cynthia is 35 years old her child is still in school.

Cynthia has a transportation business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy gasoline, spare parts and maintenance for her transportation business.

Cynthia has been in this business for 4 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy gasoline, spare parts and maintenance for her transportation business

loans.name: Siony

texts.en:
Siony is a 54 year old married woman and mother of seven children.  All seven of her children are presently in school.

Siony is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Siony buys and sells ready to wear clothes in the Philippines. Siony has been in this business for 20 years. 

Siony requested a 16,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy more inventory of ready to wear products like pants, bags, slippers, t-shirts, etc.

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more inventory of ready to wear products like pants, bags, slippers, t-shirts, etc

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Luisa is 50 years old and two of her children are still in school.

Luisa has a auto repair shop business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy equipment and materials for her business. Luisa has been in this business for 9 years. 

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy equipment and materials for her business

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 42 years old, married, and the mother of three children.  Two of her children are in school.

She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Teresita buys and sells bamboo in the Philippines.  Teresita has been in this business for 15 years.

Teresita requested a 10,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy more bamboo to sell.

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more bamboo to sell

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia is 52 years old, married, and has five children, two of whom are in school.  Emilia works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more inventory to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

Emilia has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Emilia would like to save enough money to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is 37 years old, married, and has one child, which is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Annie has a firewood sales business in the Philippines.  Annie has been in this business for six years.

Annie requested a 7,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy more firewood to sell.

In the future, Annie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more firewood to sell

loans.name: Criselda

texts.en:
Criselda is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Criselda is 44 years old and has one child who is in school. She has a tricycle passenger business in the Philippines. 

Criselda requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy wheels and other spare parts for her tricycle. She has been in this business for four years. In the future, Criselda would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy wheels and other spare parts for her tricycle.

loans.name: Liezyl

texts.en:
Liezyl works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock of products to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, coffee, sugar, etc.

Liezyl has been in this business for five years now. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of products to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, coffee, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna, 47, is a married woman with six children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Edna has a used clothing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years. She has requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more used clothing to sell.

In the future, Edna would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 30 years old and married with four children, three of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, groceries, etc. to sell.

Mary Ann has been in this business for 4 years. 

In the future, Mary Ann would like to save enough money so that she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to resell at her general store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cheese, native eggs, and meat.

loans.name: Ana Marie

texts.en:
Ana Marie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a photocopier business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for five years now.

Ana Marie has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials to use for her business such as ink and bond papers and other supplies.

In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials to use for her printing business.

loans.name: Mayela De Los Angeles

texts.es: Mayela de los Angeles, tiene la edad  de 43 años, está casada,  vive con sus hijos y esposo, los cuales su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de semilla de frijol de buena calidad y que se adapte bien a las condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta la zona  y de fertilizantes y otros productos para aplicarle a la siembra y en el desarrollo del cultivo, además pagar mano de obra en la preparacion del terreno  y para la aplicación de los productos y asistencia de la plantación una vez que tenga desarrollo, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones que cuenta la zona para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo de granos básicos. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad al igual que una cosecha adecuada, y tener a corto plazo una producción importante. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en el bienestar y estudio de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos eshtatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Mayela de los Angeles is 43 years old, married, and lives with her children and husband who are her greatest priority. With her loan she plans to buy good quality bean seeds that will adapt well to the zone’s climate and soil. She will also buy fertilizer and other products to apply to the cultivated land throughout the crop’s development. In addition, she will pay the labor costs for the preparation of the land, the application of the products, and for help in the field once it develops. In this way she will ensure the job is done well. She plans to take advantage of the zone’s good conditions for this crop, and also to put into practice her several years of experience in managing grains. She will be able to buy better products of higher quality so that her farm will have good development and health, as well as a sufficient harvest and an important production in the short run.

She wants to use the income that she hopes to obtain from the harvest for the wellbeing and education of her family, to accomplish some family goals, and to continue investing in farming. This is the first loan that she has received from FUDECOSUR. She has not had any other loans with state banks before, but FUDECOSUR has given her this loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to plant beans.

loans.name: Irish

texts.en:
Irish is a woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Irish is 30 years old and her child is in school.

Irish has a food vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Irish has been in this business for 1 year now. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Juditha

texts.en:
Juditha is married with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Juditha is 44 years old and two of her children are in school.

She has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines. Juditha requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell. She has been in this business for 3 years. 

In the future, Juditha would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Melba

texts.en:
Melba is 48 years old and has four children. She is married and has one child is still in school. Melba is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Melba has been in this business for four years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Nataly

texts.es: Con amplia experiencia en estética y tratamientos de belleza, Nataly de 32 años de edad inició su negocio  inspirada en su deseo de hacer lo que más le gustaba; aprendió todo lo relacionado con cuidados faciales, tratamientos para cabello y  arreglo de uñas.  Sus servicios los ofrece a domicilio y  todos los días está disponible en los horarios de 9 a.m. a 7 p.m., gracias a tener un horario muy amplio sus clientes pueden realizarse blower, peinados, cortes de cabello, manicure y  pedicure, Nataly siempre lleva a la mano productos para cualquier servicio adicional que deseen.  Sus servicios son cancelados de contado, aunque también les ofrece facilidad de pago a sus más fieles clientes. En la actualidad por no contar con liquidez para realizar unas compras de productos necesarios para la prestación de sus servicios, está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en shampoo, tintes, masaje y esmaltes de uñas.
