Esta inversión permitirá ofrecer un servicio de mejor calidad y que cumpla con las expectativas de su clientela.  Nataly es madre de una niña de siete años de edad a quien desea continuar ofreciendo bienestar y una mejor calidad de vida. Su meta a futuro es abrir su propio salón de belleza.
texts.en:
With extensive experience in cosmetic and beauty treatments, Nataly, at 32 years of age, began her business inspired by a desire to do what she most loved.  She learned everything related to facial care, hair treatments, and nail grooming.  She offers her services at home and every day she is available between 9 am and 7 pm.  Thanks to her open schedule, her customers can receive blowouts, hairstyles, haircuts, manicures, and pedicures.  Nataly always brings products for whatever additional service they may want.  Her services are paid for in cash, although she also offers ease of payment for her most loyal customers.  

At the present time, since she does not have the money to buy the products necessary for her services, she is applying for a Kiva loan, her first financing through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which she will invest in shampoo, dyes, massage products, and nail polishes.  This investment will allow her to offer a higher quality of service to meet the expectations of her customers.  Nataly is mother of a 7-year-old girl, to whom she wants to provide a better quality of life and well-being.  Her future goal is to open her own beauty salon.

loans.use: to invest in shampoo, dyes, massage products, and nail polishes.

loans.name: Minata's Group

texts.fr: Minata qui se trouve sur la photo détenant le papier blanc de myAgro, est membre d’un groupe de 16 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Zamblebougou au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Minata, âgée de 63 ans, est la mère de 6 enfants dont l'1 d’entre eux est actuellement scolarisé. Son mariage avec un agriculteur l’a incité à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 20 ans. Minata cultive l'arachide, le mais, le maraichage, le fonio sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque de matériels agricoles et d'herbicides. Minata entame sa première année avec myAgro, et s'est inscrite en raison des semences de qualité et des formations et techniques agricoles. Cette année Minata effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.125 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 20 ans que Minata cultive l'arachide pour sa valeur vivrière, expliquant que l’arachide est directement consommable par la famille et est utilisée comme sauce de base dans l’alimentation et aussi pour sa valeur commerciale, car l’arachide est un aliment qu’elle vend sur le marché. Minata planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  de faire de l'élevage. Enfin Minata espère aussi pouvoir financer le mariage de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Minata, holding a myAgro piece of white paper in the photo, is a member of a group of 16 farmers registered at myAgro, all living and working in the village of Zamblebougou in southeastern Bamako, Mali.
Minata is 63 years old and the mother of 6 children, one of whom currently attends school. She has been in this business for twenty years since marrying a farmer. She grows peanuts, maize, kitchen vegetables and fonio millet on her plot, but as a farmer she has to cope with problems such as a lack of farming equipment and herbicides.
Minata is into her first season with my Agro, having registered due to the quality seeds and the training in farming techniques. This year she is making payments to buy a myAgro seed and fertiliser package for growing peanuts, in order to increase the yield on her 1,250m2 piece of land. Minata has been growing peanuts for 20 years for its food value, explaining that it is both eaten by the family as is, and also used as a basic sauce in food. It also has commercial value, being a food she sells at market.
Minata is planning to be able to raise livestock with her increased yield and higher income. Finally, she hopes to be able to finance her childrens' weddings.

loans.use: to buy a package of open pollinating seeds and fertiliser for growing peanuts.

loans.name: Boulaye's Group

texts.fr: Boulaye qui se trouve sur la photo, il  porte le t-shirt blanc de MyAgro avec l'enfant en main, est membre d’un groupe de 18 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro qui vivent et travaillent dans le village de Fani Kodialan au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Boulaye, âgé de 54 ans, est le père de 8 enfants âgés de 8 à 29 ans, dont 5 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés. L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer, mais aussi l'agriculture lui permet d'assurer l'autosufficance pour sa famille, ont incité Boulaye à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 35 ans. Boulaye cultive l'arachide, le mais, le mil, le maraichage sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agriculteur à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie, de matériels agricoles et d'engrais de qualité. Boulaye entame sa troisième année avec myAgro, et s'est reinscrit en raison de la perspective de pouvoir augmenter son rendement à travers les services proposés par myAgro. Cette année Boulaye effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro d'engrais pour la culture de maïs  afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 1 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 4 ans que Boulaye cultive l'arachide pour sa valeur vivrière, expliquant que l’arachide est directement consommable par la famille et est utilisée comme sauce de base dans l’alimentation et aussi pour sa rentabilité productive et marchande. Boulaye planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  d'étendre la surface cultivée et de diversifier ses cultures comme orange et mangue. Enfin Boulaye espère aussi pouvoir couvrir les frais scolaires des enfants ainsi qu'acheter des matériels agricoles.Il a exprimé que, "apres l'agriculture, je ne pense qu'au elevage."
texts.en:
Boulaye, wearing the white t-shirt on the photo and with a child in his arms, is a member of a group of 18 farmers registered at myAgro, all living and working in the village of Fani Kodialan in southeastern Bamako, Mali.
Boulaye is 54 years old and the father of 8 children aged from 8 to 29, five of whom currently attend school. A family tradition for agriculture - the main source of income and food for the family, though it also allows the family to be self sufficient more generally - has led Boulaye to work in the sector for the last 35 years. He grows peanuts, maize, millet and kitchen vegetables on his plot, but as a farmer he has to cope with problems such as a lack of rain, of farming equipment and of quality fertilisers.
Boulaye is into his third season with my Agro, having re-registered due to the prospect of being able to increase his yields with the services offered by myAgro. 
This year he is making payments to buy a myAgro fertiliser package for growing maize, in order to increase the yield on his 1 hectare piece of land. Boulaye has been growing peanuts for 4 years for its food value, explaining that it is both eaten by the family as is, and also used as a basic sauce in food. It also has commercial value, being a food she sells at market.
Boulaye is planning to be able to extend the size of the plot he cultivates with his increased yield and higher income, as well as to diversify his plantings with orange and mango. Finally, he hopes be able to cover the childrens' schooling costs and to buy farm equipment.
He said "after farming, I am obsessed with rearing livestock".

loans.use: to get a fertiliser package for growing maize, and to benefit from agricultural training and techniques.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 39 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She has been running a general store in the Philippines for two years and also earns income from farming vegetables. She has requested a 7,000 Philippine peso (PHP) loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) to buy items to sell, such as canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, spices, and noodles, etc.

Emily has borrowed and paid back one previous loan from NWTF. She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy items to sell, such as canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, spices, and noodles, etc.

loans.name: Tegawendé1 Group

texts.fr: Haoua remercie kiva ainsi que tous les prêteurs. Cette brave dame avait acheter des pagnes pour vendre et son bénéfice lui a permis de s'occuper de ses enfants( solder la scolarité, nourrir, vêtir,...) puisqu'elle est seule. Haoua et son groupe ont solder leur prêt sans problème et souhaiteraient avoir un nouveau prêt. Avec ce prêt, Haoua voudrait acheter des pagnes et aussi fabriquer du savon pour vendre.Son bénéfice lui permettra de continuer à s'occuper de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Haoua thanks Kiva as well as all the lenders. This dynamic lady bought 'pagne' traditional cloths to sell, and the profit enabled her to take care of her children (pay for schooling, food and clothing,...) since she is single. Haoua and her group repaid their loan without any problems and would like to have a new loan. With this one, Haoua would like to buy pagnes and also to make soap for resale.
Her profit will allow her to continue to take care of her children.

loans.use: to buy traditional cloth, and to manufacture soap for resale.

loans.name: Rafaela

texts.en:
Rafaela works hard to support her family. She is married and has a pig-fattening business in the Philippines.

Rafaela has been in this business for 6 years now, and also earns additional income from buying and selling vegetables.

Rafaela requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure a future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Tegawendé 2 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe d'Elisabeth remercie tous les prêteurs kiva pour le soutien. Le prêt a permis à Elisabeth de faire son commerce de bois. Son bénéfice a aidé à solder la scolarité de ses enfants. Elle aimerait avoir un nouveau prêt pour payer du bois et aussi augmenter son commerce en achetant aussi des pagnes pour vendre. Après ses ventes, son bénéfice lui permettra de faire les dépenses de ses enfants et aussi de continuer son commerce.
texts.en:
Elisabeth's group are very grateful to all the Kiva lenders for the support which they have offered.  Their previous loan helped Elisabeth to continue her firewood business, and her profits were used to provide for the education of her children.

Elisabeth would like another loan to buy further supplies of firewood and expand her business by buying pagnes (traditional, wrap-around clothing) for resale.  The profits from these ventures will pay for the expenses of her children and ensure that her business continues.

loans.use: to buy firewood for resale.

loans.name: Gie Koleuré Group

texts.fr:
Le GIE Koleuré de l’association ALLAW regroupe des femmes qui habitent le même quartier et s’active dans la même activité qu’est le commerce. Elles ont comme responsable, la dame Thioro qui s’active dans le commerce de chaussures, pochettes et sacs depuis 4 ans maintenant. Elle est mariée et mère de 7 enfants dont l’ainé, un garçon de 17 ans et la cadette qui a 4 ans. Grâce au crédit, elle va acheter  deux douzaines de pochettes, 40 paires de chaussures et des sacs assortis si possible. Elle fait l’ambulante et tourne de 8h à 13h et de 15h à18h. Elle compte sa clientèle parmi ses voisines du quartier et ses connaissances travaillant dans les bureaux ; comme cela, elle aura des clients potentiels dans ces zones.
Son souhait le plus fervent serait d’ouvrir une cantine et d’agrandir son commerce afin de pouvoir épargner et penser à acquérir sa propre maison.
texts.en:
The 'Gie Koleuré' Group is made up of women who all live in the same neighbourhood and work as retailers.  

Thioro is the group representative.  She has been selling shoes and assorted bags for four years.  She is married and has seven children.  The eldest is a boy of seventeen years and the youngest is a girl of four years.

Thioro will use her loan to buy two dozen pouches, forty pairs of shoes and assorted bags.  She sells her goods on foot from eight until one, and from three until six.  Her customers are local inhabitants and people she knows who work in offices.

Thioro's greatest wish is to open a cantine and expand her business so that she can increase her savings and start thinking about buying her own home.

loans.use: to buy shoes and assorted bags for retail.

loans.name: Lourd Jane

texts.en:
Lourd Jane is a hard-working woman entrepreneur with two children.

She runs a restaurant in the Philippines. She industriously earns additional income through business ventures like selling charcoal. She has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more ingredients and utensils for her restaurant.

Lourd Jane dreams that, one day, she will be able to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients and utensils for her restaurant.

loans.name: Leopoldo

texts.en:
Leopoldo is a 43-year-old farmer. He is married with 8 children, 4 of whom are still are school and 2 are very small, 2 and 3 years old respectively. He didn't go to school as his family were very hard-up. Leopoldo's dream is to see his children grow up to be good people and have better opportunities than he had. 

He has been a coffee producer since he was 15 years old and this was always the way his family earned its living. Coffee is the main agricultural produce in the region. Leopoldo grows organic and fair trade certified coffee and as a result gets better prices for his coffee. Leopoldo sells his coffee through COCAFCAL of which he is a member. COCAFCAL enables producers to sell their coffee at better prices, exporting it to different countries around the world. 

At the moment Leopoldo is replanting his coffee crops as they have been badly affected by rust. He is currently wishing to replant a 3.5 hectare area with organically certified coffee plants. Coffee growing is Leopoldo's main source of income and replanting the estate is a matter of urgency as a good production means better income and a better quality of life for his eight children. 

Leopoldo is requesting a loan to be able to carry out the replanting of these 3.5 hectares from which he intends to obtain the best benefit possible. A loan would help Leopoldo buy all he needs to replant his estate, such as: coffee plants, organic fertilizer, organic consumables and to pay labourers. The income from his farm is used to cover his family's needs.

loans.use: to buy materials to replant his estate, such as: coffee plants, organic fertilizer, organic consumables and to pay labourers

loans.name: Lala's Group

texts.fr: Lala qui se trouve sur la photo portant une foulard verte et l'enfant sur pied au premier rang, est membre d’un groupe de 12 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Sanankoroni au sud de Bamako au Mali. Lala, âgée de 30 ans, est la mère de 5 enfants âgés de 2 à 15 ans, dont 2 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés.  L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer, mais aussi son mariage avec un agriculteur, ont incité Lala à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 25 ans. Lala cultive l'arachide sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie, de matériel agricoles et de terre cultivables. Lala entame sa deuxième année avec myAgro, et s'est réinscrite en raison de la perspective de pouvoir augmenter son rendement à travers les services proposés par myAgro. Cette année Lala effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.125 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 25 ans que Lala cultive l'arachide pour sa valeur vivrière, expliquant que l’arachide est directement consommable par la famille et est utilisée comme sauce de base dans l’alimentation et aussi pour sa valeur commerciale, car l’arachide est un aliment qu’elle vend sur le marché. Lala planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  de pouvoir faire du commerce. Enfin Lala espère aussi pouvoir assurer l'autosuffisance alimentaire de la famille.
texts.en:
Lala is seen in the front row of the photo wearing a green scarf, with a child at her feet.  She is a member of a group of twelve farmers who all work with the field partner, myAgro.  The group all live and work in the village of Sanankoroni, south of Bamako, in Mali.

Lala is 30 years old and mother to five children aged between two and fifteen years old.  Two of her children currently attend school.  Agriculture is the primary source of income for Lala's family because her husband is also a farmer.  Through this business the couple are able to provide enough food for their family.  Lala has been working in this business for twenty-five years.  She grows peanuts and has to cope with problems such as lack of rain, shortage of equipment and lack of fertile growing land.

This will be Lala's second year of working with myAgro to improve her profitability and benefit from the services offered by the field partner.  This year she plans to buy fertilizer to increase the harvest of peanuts from her 0.125 hectares of land.  She grows peanuts as they are a good source of food for families (often prepared as a sauce), and also a profitable thing to sell at the market.

Lala will use her profits to continue her business and provide for all the food needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy a bag of fertilizer to grow peanuts.

loans.name: Renira

texts.en:
Renira works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell of ready-to-wear business in the Philippines.

Renira requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like pants, shorts, shirts, etc. to sell.

Renira has been in this business for three years now.

In the future, Renira would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like pants, shorts, and shirts to sell

loans.name: Molobaly's Group

texts.fr: Molobaly qui se trouve assise sur la photo détenant la fiche blanche de myAgro et portant un foulard jaune est membre d’un groupe de 18 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Fiana au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Molobaly, âgée de 50 ans, est la mère de 2 enfants âgés de 20 à 30 ans, dont aucun d’entre eux  actuellement scolarisé scolarisé. L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer a incité Molobaly à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 30 ans. Molobaly cultive l'arachide, le mil, le riz sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque de matériels agricoles, de semences de qualité  et d'herbicides. Molobaly entame sa première année avec myAgro, et s'est inscrite en raison de la perspective de pouvoir augmenter son rendement à travers les services proposés par myAgro. Cette année Molobaly effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.0625 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 30 ans que Molobaly cultive l'arachide pour sa valeur vivrière, expliquant que l’arachide est directement consommable par la famille et est utilisée comme sauce de base dans l’alimentation et aussi pour sa valeur commerciale, car l’arachide est un aliment qu’elle vend sur le marché. Molobaly planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  de faire de l'élevage . Enfin Molobaly espère aussi pouvoir construire une maison pour la famille.
texts.en:
Molobaly is seen sitting in the photo wearing a yellow scarf, with a white form in her hand.  She is a member of a group of eighteen farmers who all work with the field partner, myAgro.  The group all live and work in the village of Fiana, south-east of Bamako, in Mali.

Molobaly is 50 years old and mother to two children aged twenty and thirty years old.  Neither of her children currently attend school.  Agriculture is the primary source of income for Molobaly's family, and through this business she is able to provide enough food for her family.  Molobaly has been working in this business for thirty years.  She grows peanuts, millet and rice and has to cope with problems such as shortage of equipment and lack of good quality seed and herbicide. 

This will be Molobaly's first year of working with myAgro to improve her profitability and benefit from the services offered by the field partner.  This year she plans to buy seed and fertilizer to increase the harvest of peanuts from her 0.0625 hectares of land.  She grows peanuts as they are a good source of food for families (often prepared as a sauce), and also a profitable thing to sell at the market.

Molobaly will use her profits to expand her business and start raising animals.  In the future, she also hopes to be able to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer to grow peanuts.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines and earns additional income from farming sugarcane and her general store businesses. Gloria is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy additional stocks of rice to sell.

Gloria has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell like canned goods, soap, shampoo, eggs, etc.

Leah has been in this business for five years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell like canned goods, soap, shampoo, and eggs

loans.name: Maria Candelaria

texts.es:
María, se siente agradecida por la oportunidad que Padecomsmcredito y Kiva le han brindado al otorgarle el préstamo anterior, su negocio ha mejorado, sus hijos tienen mejores cuidados y ha cancelado la deuda con un buen record crediticio.
Está solicitando un nuevo crédito para invertirlo en cerdos y concentrados para los pollos y el ganado, engordara sus animales para venderlos a un buen precio, mantendrá la continuidad de su desarrollo económico.
texts.en:
Maria is grateful for the opportunity given her by Padecomsmcredito and Kiva through the previous loan.  Her business has improved, her children are better taken care of and she has paid back her loan with a good credit record.

She is requesting a new loan to buy pigs and animal feed for her chickens and cattle.  She will raise the animals and sell them at a good price to continue her economic development.

loans.use: To buy pigs and feed for her chickens and cattle.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 49 years old and married with four children. Jocelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Jocelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, condiments, home care products and other groceries.

Jocelyn has been in this business for eight years now. 

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, condiments, home care products and other grocerires

loans.name: Yenifer Maria

texts.es:
Yenifer es una joven que va a estudiar medicina, ella solicita un préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos educativos, esta es su historia: 
Hola mi nombre es Yenifer , mi edad es de 19 años, vivo en la localidad de Licey, Hoya grande, un campo de La Vega en República Dominicana, pero mi lugar de nacimiento original es Cayetano Germosen, provincia Espaillat, crecí en el poblado de Licey, Hoya grande de donde desciende mi madre.
Tengo 1 hermano con el cual convivo, no soy casada pero tengo un hijo al cual amo mucho y por él y mi familia por la cual lucho. Solo tengo a mi madre, porque mi padre falleció cuando tenía solo 9 meses de nacida.
Deseo estudiar de todo corazón en UCATECI y la carrera de vocación solo quiero estudiar Medicina porque quiero ayudar a todo aquel que como yo quiere salir adelante y quiero hacerlo encargándome del cuidado de la salud de cada persona que necesite de mis conocimientos.
No he empezado a estudiar pero deseo de todo corazón que cada una de las materias que escoja sea siempre de desarrollo para mi futuro y sean todas de mi agrado.
Necesito el préstamo porque mi madre ni yo tenemos los recursos necesario para costear mi carrera y porque el deseo de estudio me hace luchar por lo que quiero y por lograr no solo prevenir para mí, sino para mi familia y de todo aquel que necesite de mi lo que pueda ayudar y ser buena en lo que realice y ese sea el motivo de superación.
Si no tengo esta ayuda no podría realmente estudiar porque no tengo los recursos que exige la carrera de no poderlo conseguir realmente me quedaría sin estudiar porque no tengo lo estimado de la carrera.
Este préstamo cambiaría mi vida, mi futuro, mi todo… lo necesito de verdad.
Mis metas académicas son lograr rebasar los pensamientos, demostrar que si se puede con la ayuda de Dios y hacer sentir aquellos que no creen, que el “Que quiere puede”, y después de terminar mi carrera deseo de todo corazón ayudar a aquel que no tiene recursos y aportar conocimientos al mundo y ser aún más solidaria, humilde con aquellos que requieran de mí.
Deseo ayudar y llegar donde aquellos no llegan… lograr ser aceptada y querida y aportar siempre mis conocimientos.
texts.en:
Yenifer is a young lady who plans to study medicine.  She is requesting a loan to cover her education costs and this is her story:

Hi, my name is Yenifer.  I am 19 and live in Licey, Hoya Grande, in the countryside of La Vega in the Dominican Republic.  I am originally from Cayetano Germosen in the province of Espaillat, but I grew up in Licey, Hoya Grande where my mother is from.  I have a brother who lives with me.  I am not married but I have a son who I love very much.  I struggle for him and my family.  I only have my mother now since my dad passed away when I was nine months old.

With all my heart I want to study medicine at the UCATECI.  I wish to help people like myself to get ahead by caring for their health through my knowledge.  I have not begun my education yet but I hope to choose the right subjects for my future development and interest.

I am in need of a loan because neither my mother nor I have the resources to pay for my education.  My desire to study makes me determined to meet my goals, not only for myself but also for my family and everyone who needs my help.  I want to be good at what I do and that is my motivation.

If I do not receive this help I cannot get the education I want because I cannot afford the cost of the study program.  This loan will change my life, my future, my everything.... I truly need it.

My academic goals are to go beyond mere thinking, by demonstrating that "You can do something if you really want to".  After I finish my education I want to help people with low incomes and become more supportive and humble with those who need me.

I want to help and go where no one has gone before, to be accepted and loved, and always to contribute my knowledge.

loans.use: To cover higher education costs.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a hardworking 33-year-old farmer from the Ndaragwa area of Kenya. He separated from his wife but still fulfills his roles and duties as a father of three children between 3 and 12 years old. To provide for his family, Charles practices dairy, poultry, livestock, horticultural and lumber farming. He has over 4,000 trees on his 5-acre piece of land!

Charles faces a big transportation challenge posed by the remoteness of his farm. He has to travel many kilometers to access the nearest market. This makes transportation of farm produce cumbersome and expensive to say the least.

Charles is seeking a KES 60,000 to buy an Indian motorcycle custom-made for poor farmers living in hardship areas. With this asset, he will be able to transport his produce to the market as often as his business allows in a timely and convenient fashion. The motorcycle will also enhance his market reach.
 
With your loan, Charles will be presented with a perfect opportunity to change his livelihood forever.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for farm transportation

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 38 years old and married with two children. With two children in school, Josephine works very hard to provide for them.

Josephine runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, personal care products and other groceries.

Josephine has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as bread, candies, junk foods, coffee and other groceries. 

In the future, Josephine would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, personal care products and other groceries

loans.name: María Ruth

texts.es: María Ruth tiene la edad  de 25 años, está casada,  vive con sus hijos y esposo, los cuales su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de semilla de frijol de buena calidad y que se adapte bien a las condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta la zona, ademas que tends un desarrollo adecuado para que tenga la capacidad de cosechar mejor, y de fertilizantes y otros productos para aplicarle a la siembra y en el desarrollo del cultivo, además pagar mano de obra en la preparacion del terreno  y para la aplicación de los productos y asistencia de la plantación una vez que tenga desarrollo, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones que cuenta la zona para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo de granos básicos. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad al igual que una cosecha adecuada, y tener a corto plazo una producción importante. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en el bienestar y estudio de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos eshtatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Maria Ruth is 25 years old, married and lives wtih her husband and children, who are her main priority.  She plans to use the loan to buy quality bean seeds suited to the climate and soil of her area, in order to obtain a better harvest.  She also must buy fertilizers and other products for crop development, and hire workers to prepare the land and apply the products once the crop has grown.  This will guarantee a job well done.  She wants to take advantage of the good conditions in the area for this type of crop and also use her many years of experience in handling basic grains.

Her aim is to buy quality products to produce the best crop in the shortest amount of time possible.  She hopes to use the income from the harvested crop for her family's well-being and education, and to meet some of the family goals.  She also will invest more in her crop activity.

This is her first loan through FUDECOSUR.  She has never received any state bank loans and FUDECOSUR is giving her better payment terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: To plant beans.

loans.name: Maria Emilia

texts.es:
María, requiere de un nuevo financiamiento para comprar granos básicos, toallas sanitarias, bebidas, huevos, pastas, papel higiénico, y otros productos para que la tienda tenga un mejor inventario, María comenta que con las ganancias que está teniendo las ahorrara para hacer mejoras a su vivienda.
Con al crédito anterior pudo comprarse mercadería que sus clientes buscaban en su establecimiento, actualmente  cuenta con clientes satisfechos y tiene la oportunidad de darle a su familia un mejor estilo de vida.
texts.en: Maria is requesting a new loan to buy basic grains, feminine hygiene products, beverages, eggs, pastas, toilet paper and other items to increase her inventory.  She says she will use the profit she earns for home improvement.  She used the previous loan to buy merchandise requested by her customers.  Her customers are satisfed and she currently has the opportunity to give her family a better lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy basic grains, feminine hygiene products, beverages, eggs, pastas, toilet paper and other items for her store.

loans.name: Vilma Rosibel

texts.es: Vilma, tiene 32 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene una hija a su cargo y reside en una aldea de la Masica, Atlántida junto a su hija. Vilma cuenta con su propio negocio de venta de golosinas como churros, refrescos, jugos y vende comidas los fines de semana como ser pastelitos, pollo frito con tajadas y otras. Esta actividad la realiza en su casa. Ha decidido solicitar el segundo préstamo en la institución y es por 18,000 lempiras para comprar refrescos, jugos, churros, e insumos para la elaboración de comidas y vender. El fin de invertir es para aumentar sus ventas e ingresos y sacar adelante a su hija.
texts.en: Vilma, 32, is a single mother with a daughter in her care.  She lives in the village of Masica, Atlantida, with her daughter.  Vilma has her own business and sells sweets such as donuts, soft drinks and juices, and sells food such as little pies, fried chicken, and others, on weekends.  She works from home and has decided to request a new loan in the amount of 18,000 HNL to buy soft drinks, juices, donuts and supplies to make the food she sells.  Her goal is to increase sales and income to support her daughter.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks, juices, donuts and supplies to make food to sell.

loans.name: Nianamba's Group

texts.fr: Nianamba qui se trouve sur la photo au centre, à coté d'une femme qui porte un t-shirt rouge, elle  tiens la corde droit du  drapeau de MYAgro, est membre d’un groupe de 26 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivent et travaillent dans le village de Sanankoro-Djitoumou au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Nianamba, âgée de 60 ans, est la mère de 3 enfants âgés de 25 à 33 ans, et dont l'un d’entre eux est actuellement scolarisé. L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer, mais aussi l'agriculture lui permet d'assurer l'autosufficance pour sa famille, ont incité Nianamba à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 50 ans. Elle a mentionné que, "on apprend toujours l'agriculture jusqu’à la mort." Nianamba cultive l'arachide sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie, de matériels agricoles et d'engrais de qualité. Nianamba entame sa deuxième année avec myAgro, et s'est reinscrite en raison du système de paiement et des formations et techniques agricoles. Cette année Nianamba effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.125 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 50 ans que Nianamba cultive l'arachide pour sa valeur vivrière, expliquant que l’arachide est directement consommable par la famille et est utilisée comme sauce de base dans l’alimentation et aussi pour sa valeur commerciale, car l’arachide est un aliment qu’elle vend sur le marché. Nianamba planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  de faire de l'élevage de chèvres ou de moutons . Elle a mentionné que, "le monde ne restera pas d'une phase, ça change de temps en temps." Enfin Nianamba espère aussi pouvoir couvrir les frais scolaires des enfants ainsi qu'assurer l'autosuffisance alimentaire de la famille.
texts.en:
Nianamba is seen in the centre of the photo holding the myAgro flag.  She is standing next to a woman who is wearing a red t-shirt.  Nianamba is a member of a group of twenty-six farmers who all work with the field partner, myAgro.  The group all live and work in the village of Sanankoro-Djitoumou, south-east of Bamako, in Mali.

Nianamba is 60 years old and mother to three children aged between twenty-five and thirty-three years old.  One of her children still attends school.  Agriculture is the primary source of income for Nianamba's family,she often says that you continue learning in agriculture until your death.  Through this business she is able to provide enough food for her family.  Nianamba has been working in this business for fifty years.  She grows peanuts and has to cope with problems such as lack of rain, shortage of equipment and lack of high quality fertilizer.

This will be Nianamba's second year of working with myAgro to improve her profitability and benefit from the services offered by the field partner.  This year she plans to buy fertilizer to increase the harvest of peanuts from her 0.125 hectares of land.  She grows peanuts as they are a good source of food for families (often prepared as a sauce), and also a profitable thing to sell at the market.

Nianamba will use her profits to expand her business and begin raising either sheep or goats.  She says that the world does not stay the same, it is constantly changing.  In the future, she hopes to be able to cover the education costs of her children and provide for all the food needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to grow peanuts.

loans.name: Aracelie

texts.en:
Aracelie works hard to support her family. Aracelie is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Aracelie has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Aracelie would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Editha works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and earns additional income from pig fattening.  Editha is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell in her store.

Editha has been sustaining her business activities through her past 25 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz is 57 years old and married with three children. Luz works very hard to provide for them.

Luz runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her general store.

Luz has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as vegetables, chicken, eggs, vinegar, soy sauce, condiments and other groceries. 

In the future, Luz would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Judith works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell of hollow blocks business in the Philippines and earns additional income from fishing. Judith is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more hollow blocks to sell.

Judith has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more hollow blocks to sell

loans.name: Erneste

texts.en:
Erneste is 50 years old. He is married with two children aged 12 and 15 years, who both go to school. 

Erneste owns a shop and he has been in this business for the past two years. With the loan, he would like to buy more salt, shoe polish, biscuits and salt for sell. The profits from the business will be used to renovate his house and improve his welfare.

loans.use: To buy more salt, shoe polish, biscuits and salt for sell.

loans.name: Ma. Nelly

texts.en:
As a widowed mother of five children, Ma. Nelly works hard to support her family.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines and earns additional income from passenger transportation. Ma. Nelly is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Ma. Nelly has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Desmus

texts.en:
Hello world, meet Desmus. Desmus is a small-holder farmer from the Bomet area of Kenya. He spends his days looking after his cow and tending to his farm. He is married and has three children between 7 months and 5 years. Only one child is attending school as of now.
 
Desmus has been a farmer for a decade. He owns a 1-acre piece of land where he keeps one dairy cow and 10 head of poultry and has planted over 50 trees. He is seeking a loan of KES 20,000 to expand his poultry business. He will use your money to buy a brood of hens. These hens will lay eggs and hatch chicks. He will make income by selling poultry products such as eggs, chicks, meat and cockerels. 

Part of the profits from this investment will be rolled back into the business for growth while the rest will be used to meet the family's basic needs such as food security.

loans.use: to buy poultry

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: Francisco, tiene la edad  de 45 años, está casado,  vive con sus hijos y esposa, los cuales su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de semilla de frijol de buena calidad y que se adapte bien a las condiciones de la zona y de fertilizantes y otros productos para aplicarle a la siembra y en el desarrollo del cultivo, además pagar mano de obra para la aplicación de los productos mecanizacion del terreno ademas de asistencia de la plantación una vez que tenga desarrollo, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones que cuenta la zona para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo de granos básicos. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad al igual que una cosecha adecuada, y tener a corto plazo una producción importante. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en el bienestar y estudio de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos eshtatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Francisco is 45 years old and married. He lives with his wife and children, all of whom are his top priority. 

Francisco intends to use this loan to buy quality bean seeds that will adapt to local conditions. He will also buy fertilisers and other products to help with sowing and the growth of the crops. Furthermore, Francisco will pay labourers to apply the products on the land, and to help with the plantation once it has developed. He can thus ensure a good yield. 

Francisco wants to take advantage of the good conditions for growing beans in the local area. He also wants to put his many years of experience of looking after basic grains into practice. As well as being able to buy quality products so that his plants grow well and in good health, Francisco also wants a good yield. 

Francisco will use the income that he hopes to earn from his harvest to look after his family’s well-being and their education. He also wants to achieve some family goals and to continue investing in his crops. This is Francisco’s first loan from FUDECOSUR. He has taken out no other loans with state banks. FUDECOSUR has provided this loan will great facility and much lower interest rates.

loans.use: to grow beans.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in metal sheeting, wood and nails to replace the roof and walls in her home.

loans.name: Denilson

texts.en:
Denilson is a down-to-earth farmer from the Bomet area of Kenya who is newly married and a father to a 3-month old child. He started farming only four years ago, yet he has been able to do so much in the short period of time he has been a farmer. Denilson owns a 5-acre piece of land where he keeps his one and only cow and has planted over 300 trees. This year, his plan is to venture into poultry farming.
 
Denilson is seeking a loan of KES 10,000 to purchase poultry. This loan will be able to afford him around 20 head of poultry, which will serve as a good start for a farmer fresh into the poultry business. He will make income selling eggs, chicks, meat and cockerels at the market. 

The additional income will help him to financially take care of his newborn's needs such as food, medication, clothing etc. Once the loan is fully serviced, Denilson plans to take a bigger loan to grow his business further.

loans.use: to buy poultry

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Leonora works hard to support her family.

She has a fruit vending business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from her general store.  Leonora is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock of fruit to sell for her fruit vending business.

Leonora has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of fruit to sell

loans.name: Mediatrice

texts.en: Mediatrice is 37 years old. She is married with five children who are 2 and 16 years old. Three of them go to school. She owns a shop, and she has been in business for the past two years. With the loan, she would like to buy more soap, sugar, and salt to sell. The profits from the business will be used to improve her welfare. In the future, she wishes to earn at least 200,000 RWF per month.

loans.use: To buy more soap, sugar, and salt to sell.

loans.name: Devote

texts.en: Devote is 37 years old. She is married with four children who are between 4 and 18 years old. Three of them go to school. While her husband is a farmer, Devote sells food and has been in a business for seven years. With the loan, she would like to buy more cassava, banana, and sorghum to sell. The profits from the business will be used to build a house. In the future, she aims to earn at least 400,000 RWF per month.

loans.use: To buy more cassava, banana, and sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Bella

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Ma. Bella works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell personal care product business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from her general store.  Ma. Bella is borrowing 18,000 PHP through NWTF to buy items to sell like lotion, etc., for her buy-and-sell personal care product business.

Ma. Bella has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items like lotion, etc., for her personal care product business.

loans.name: Ma. Teresa

texts.en:
Ma. Teresa is a 55-year-old widowed woman with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Ma. Teresa has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a 5,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Ma. Teresa has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is a 37-year-old married woman with five children, four of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Maricel has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy containers of coconut wine to sell.

Maricel has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy containers of coconut wine to sell.

loans.name: Ana Gricelda

texts.es:
Ana, se dedica a vender electrodomésticos, vive con su esposo y un hijo que se dedica a estudiar, trabaja junto a su pareja para salir a delante, el oficio lo aprendió de su esposo y lo realiza desde hace cinco años no tiene un horario establecido, Ana también tiene un empleo de medio tiempo como tutora de un proyecto en su iglesia.
Comprará planchas, licuadoras, baterías de cocina, etc., en mayor cantidad para ahorrar en la compra y poder venderlos a precios accesibles, pero que también le dejen mejores ganancias, espera poder ampliar su negocio y atender a nuevos clientes.
Los sueños que Ana tiene son mejorar la apariencia de su vivienda y darle a su familia mejor vida.
texts.en:
Ana sells appliances. She lives with her husband and a son who is in school. She works with her spouse to get ahead. She learned her trade from her husband and has done it for five years. She has no set schedule. Ana also has a part time job as a teacher at a project in her church. 

She will buy irons, blenders, kitchenware, etc., in larger quantities to save money and sell them at accessible prices and also leave her with better prices. She hopes to expand her business and serve new customers. 

Ana's dream is to improve the appearance of her home and give her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy irons, blenders, kitchenware, etc. in larger quantities to save money and sell them at accessible prices.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es: Manuel, tiene la edad  de 55 años, está casado,  vive con su hijo y esposa, los cuales su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de semilla de frijol de buena calidad y que se adapte bien a las condiciones de clima, suelo y las cantidad de agua de lluvia que resenta la region  y de fertilizantes y otros productos para aplicarle a la siembra y en el desarrollo del cultivo, además pagar mano de obra para la aplicación de los productos y asistencia de la plantación una vez que tenga desarrollo, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones que cuenta la zona para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo de granos básicos. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad al igual que una cosecha adecuada, y tener a corto plazo una producción importante. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en el bienestar y estudio de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos eshtatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Manuel is 55 years old and married. He lives with his son and wife, who are his main priority.

With this loan, he wants to buy bean seeds of good quality that adapt well to the local climate, soil, and rainfall conditions. He will also buy fertilizers and other supplies for sowing and maintaining the plantations, and pay for the labor needed to spread them and keep the crops in good shape once they have grown. This will help him to make sure everything will be well done.

Manuel wants to take advantage of the good local conditions for growing beans and of his experience in agriculture. He will be able to buy the best quality products so that his crops can grow strong and healthy and he can have a good harvest and good results in the short term.

With the profits from this harvest he will invest in his family’s well-being, his son’s studies and in some improvements he wants to make, and will reinvest in his plantations. This is his first loan from FUDECOSUR. He had not received any loan before from public banks, but FUDECOSUR offered him a loan more easily and with a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy bean seeds and fertilizers, and pay for the labor needed to spread them.

loans.name: Cirilo

texts.es:
Cirilo es  un hombre de 26 años de edad, es casado tiene una linda familia de tres hijos de las edades entre dos y un año, esta familia vive en una comunidad de Suchitepéquez.
Cirilo con el afán de obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a sus hijos, se dedica a la albañilería desde hace seis años.
Cirilo es un gran albañil que trabaja día con día con mucha pasión a su trabajo, él está solicitando un préstamo porque necesita comprar algunas herramientas como barreno, martillos entre otros.
El gran sueño de Cirilo es llegar hacer un gran maestro de obra para mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Cirilo is a 26 year old man. He is married and has a beautiful family with three children between the ages of two and one. The family lives in the community of Suchitepéquez.

In order to obtain income and get his children ahead, Cirilo has worked as a bricklayer for six years. Cirilo is a great bricklayer who works day to day with a lot of passion for his work. He is asking for a loan because he needs to buy some tools such as a drill, hammers and more. 

Cirilo's big dream is to be a great master builder to improve his income.

loans.use: to buy tools such as a drill and hammers.

loans.name: Rosa Antonio

texts.es:
Rosa Antonio es un productor de café de la zona norte de Nicaragua. Tiene 3 hijos junto a su esposa, quienes apoyan en las actividades de la finca, la cual está certificada por Comercio Justo, UTZ y C.A.F.E. Practices. En los últimos ciclos este productor ha logrado cosechar hasta 28 quintales de café pergamino de primera calidad.

Para este año, él está solicitando un financiamiento para comprar los insumos agrícolas que requiere su cafetal, lograr una mejor producción. La meta de este pequeño productor es mejorar los rendimientos de su cafetal, y poder llegar a producir 100 quintales de café de primera calidad, para lo cual se ha propuesto la implementación de un plan de mejoramiento nutricional.
texts.en:
Rosa Antonio is a coffee producer from Northern Nicaragua. He and his wife have three children, who help them with the farming activities. Their farm is certified under Fair Trade, UTZ and C.A.F.E Practices standards. For the last seasons, he has been able to grow up to 28 quintals [2,800 lbs.] of dry parchment coffee of the highest quality.

For this year, Rosa Antonio is requesting a loan to buy agricultural supplies for his coffee plantations and improve his production. His goal is to obtain a better yield and be able to produce 100 quintals [10,000 lbs.] of high-quality coffee. In order to achieve this, he has designed a plan to better nurture his plantations.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for his coffee plantations.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy insecticides, fertilizer, improved corn seeds and other important materials to develop the first crop of the year.

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Ii Group

texts.es: Ana es la más joven de una asociación de mujeres que se dedican a vender comida en kioscos que están ubicados en un lugar que es muy visitado por tener atractivos turísticos, como una imagen que comentan que es milagrosa,  hay picinas, un rio muy llamativo,  juegos para los niños, espacios verdes entre otros.  Ella es la encargada de hacer los trámites para solicitar al gobierno local las ayudas para la adecuación de sus pequeños kioscos. Ellas  hasta ahora han logrado poner viseras y poner cemento en los pisos que eran de tierra y que cuando llovía se hacía lodo y esto hacia que menoren sus ventas, Ana comenta que desde que estaba en la escuela le ayudaba a su madre en este negocio de venta de comidas y  al fallecer su madre Ana siguió adelante con esta actividad. Ana es madre soltera y vive con su padre y sus 2 hijos que están estudiando. Ana y sus compañeras van a invertir el crédito en la compra de productos como papas, arroz, choclos, carne de pollo, carne de res, carne de chanchos, verduras, frutas para los jugos y más productos para preparar almuerzos y demás comidas que son típicas de la Provincia del Carchi. Ana comenta que con el crédito  individual que sacaron  anteriormente en esta institución  readecuaron su negocio. A  Ana le encantaría poder mejorar su negocio y  aumentar las ventas para tener mejores ingresos  y de ser posible ahorrar algo de dinero para formar un capital con el que a  futuro compraran cocinas, mesas, sillas, vajilla y junto a sus compañeras seguir acomodando los kioscos poco a poco hasta que sean bien presentables.
texts.en:
Ana is the youngest of a communal bank made up of women who work selling food in kiosks located in a place which receives a lot of visitors due to its tourist attractions. These include an image which is said to be miraculous, swimming pools, a striking river, games for children and green spaces, among other things.

She is in charge of the procedures for applying for help from the local government to renovate their small kiosks. Up until now they have managed to put up sunshades and to put cement in the floors. These were previously made of earth, meaning they would turn to mud in the rain, causing their sales to lower.

Ana says that ever since she was in school she helped her mother in the food sales business, and when her mother died Ana continued on with this work. Ana is a single mother and lives with her father and two children, who are studying. Ana and her colleagues are going to invest the loan in the purchase of products such as potatoes, rice, corn on the cob, beef, pork, vegetables, fruits for juices and other products to make lunches and other foods which are typical of the Carchi Provence.

Ana says that with the individual loan that they received previously in this institution they renovated their business. Ana would love to be able to improve her business and increase sales in order to have better earnings and be able to save some money. In the future, with this capital, she will buy stoves, tables, seats and dinnerware, and together with her colleagues continue adapting the kiosks little by little until they are well presentable.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, rice, corn on the cob, chicken, beef, pork, vegetables, fruits for juices and other products to make lunches  and other typical foods.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cement, sand and labor needed to improve the walls of his home.

loans.name: Ronny

texts.en:
Hello lenders! Now it’s time for us to introduce you to one of Ruma’s agents, Ronny. Ronny lives in Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. Ronny is happily married, and together with his wife, they have two children. As a main source of income, Ronny owns and manages a small stall that sell daily consumer products. He feels excited to learn more about mobile technology from Ruma’s mobile application. His community sees Ronny as a trusted and friendly mobile provider, as well as a kind & cheerful person. 

Ronny has become an agent for Ruma’s layaway product designed for lower income communities called 'Mapan'. Mapan enables customers to save up, little by little, by depositing change at agents like Ronny and as their balance grows, it allows customers to make major asset purchases like housewares, appliances, and school supplies for their children.  

As a Mapan agent, Ronny is responsible for processing deposits from customers into their Mapan accounts as well as receiving orders from customers who want to buy products listed in Ruma's Mapan catalog. When a customer orders, Ronny will submit the order via SMS and, within 5-10 days, the product will be delivered to the customer. With Mapan, Ronny believes that his community will be able to have access to higher quality products with better prices. Ronny feels happy because since he is becoming a Mapan agent, he can give more contribution to his community who need access to such service.

As seen in the photo, Ronny is the one who is standing. He is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to increase the working capital deposit needed for helping community members save more to purchase through Ruma's layaway product called Mapan.

loans.name: Bryan Gerardo

texts.es: Bryan Gerardo, tiene la edad  de 18 años, está soltero,  vive con sus padres y hermanos, los cuales su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de semilla de frijol de buena calidad y que se adapte bien a las condiciones de la zona y de fertilizantes y otros productos para aplicarle a la siembra y en el desarrollo del cultivo, además pagar mano de obra en la preparacion del terreno y hacer trabajos de consevacion de suelos y tambien para la aplicación de los productos y asistencia de la plantación una vez que tenga desarrollo, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones que cuenta la zona para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo de granos básicos. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad al igual que una cosecha adecuada, y tener a corto plazo una producción importante. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en el bienestar y estudio de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos eshtatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Bryan Gerardo is 18 years old. He is single and lives with his parents and siblings, who are his first priority. With his loan, he plans to buy good quality bean seed that adapts well to the conditions of the area and fertilizers and other products to apply to and for the development of the crops. Also, he will pay laborers to prepare the land and perform ground conservation jobs and also apply the products and help on the farm once its developed and thus assure a good job is performed.

He intends to take advantage of the area's good conditions for this crop and also put into practice the various years' experience he has with basic grains. Also to be able to buy the best products and best quality so his farm develops well and healthily as well as an adequate harvest and a significant short-term production. With the income from the harvest that he hopes to obtain, he wants to use it for the well being and education of his family and to achieve some family goals and keep investing in the crops more. This is the first loan that he has received from FUDECOSUR. He has not had any previous loans from state banks but FUDECOSUR has provided the loan with greater ease and the interest rate is a lot lower.

loans.use: to plant beans.

loans.name: Jahayra Elieth

texts.es:
Jahaira Elieth tiene la edad de 37 años, es Ingeniera en Sistema, su papa con sacrificio le pagó todos sus estudios, siendo ella hija única recibió de sus padres mucho amor, dedicación y educación, proviene de una familia juigalpina de buenas costumbres muy trabajadora;  ahora Jahayra tiene su propia familia formada por ella, su esposo y su niño, habitan en casa de su suegros, trabaja en la Municipalidad desde hace mas de 5 años, es la encargada del Cyber donde llegan los estudiantes de todos los colegios a realizar sus investigaciones a precios cómodos  por ser un beneficio que brinda la Municipalidad a Estudiantes que lo necesitan sobre todo de escasos de recursos, además vende productos de cosméticos a compañeros de trabajos que le encargan, esta labor la realiza en tiempos libres para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y así sacar adelante a su pequeño hijo sin muchas dificultades.

Jahaira se empeña día a día para brindar mejores condiciones en el hogar a su familia, los créditos que Afodenic los ha invertido en gastos de deudas y mejoras de la Vivienda, ha realizado anexos, ha reparados algunas paredes entre otras mejoras necesarias.  Este  préstamo lo quiere para comprar un lava manos, cemento, arena, arenilla, accesorios para el baño, cerámica,tubos  y otros que necesita en la remodelación del baño e inodoro que en la actualidad tiene fugas de agua, con el fin de brindar comodidad y buena higiene en el hogar a su familia.

Si Dios le permite desea después hacer otro crédito para comprar su propio vehículo para transportarse a su trabajo diario y salir con su familia los fines de semanas que son los día libre de ella,  el vehículo es necesarios para hacer las compras alimenticias y mas que un lujo se convierte en una necesidad por la distancias que recorre a diario para llegar a su trabajo.
texts.en:
Jahaira Elieth is 37 years old. She is a systems engineer. Her father, through sacrifice, paid for all of her education. As she was the only daughter, she received a lot of love, dedication and education from her parents. She comes from a Juigalpina family who has hard working customs. Now Jahayra has her own family. Her husband and her son live in her in-laws' home. She has worked for the municipality for more than five years. She is in charge of Cyber whereby the students from all of the schools come to do their research at low prices as a benefit provided by the municipality to students who need it due to scarce resources. She also sells cosmetic products to colleagues. She performs this work in her free time to help her husband with the bills and thus get her small son ahead without much difficulty.

Jahaira works day after day to provide better living conditions to her family. She has invested the Afodenic loans in debt expenses and home improvements. She has made annexes, repaired some walls, among other needed improvements. She needs this loan to buy a basin, cement, sand, grit, bathroom accessories, ceramic, tubes and other items needed for the remodeling of the bathroom and toilet which currently leaks, with the end goal of providing comfort and good hygiene at home to her family.

If God allows it, she wishes to later make another loan to buy her own car to transport herself to her daily work and go out with her family on weekends, which are her free days. The vehicle is necessary to make grocery purchases and, more than a luxury, it is a necessity due to the distances she has to travel each day to get to work.

loans.use: to invest in costs of remodeling a bathroom and leaky toilet which will help her family enjoy better living conditions.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 47 years old and single.

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Gemma requested a PHP 26000 loan through NWTF to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Gemma has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed 9 times in the past from NWTF and more recently, from Kiva to sustain it.

She is working tirelessly towards her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 35 years old and married with two children. With both children in school, Marilyn works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, personal product care and other groceries.

She has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, soap, soft drinks, junk foods, biscuits, candle and other groceries. 

In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, personal product care and other groceries

loans.name: Luciano

texts.es:
Luciano, tiene una familia compuesta por su compañera de vida y tres hijos, tiene la responsabilidad de cubrir todas las necesidades de su familia, se dedica a realizar trabajos agrícolas cultivando principalmente maíz y frijol, administra solo su negocio, lleva más de 39 años realizando dicha actividad, el oficio lo heredo de su familia, su horario de trabajo es de seis de la mañana  a dos de la tarde.
Comprará plaguicidas, abono y semilla para mejorar la cosecha de granos básicos, espera tener todo lo necesario a su alcance para cuando inicie el invierno, pretende que su negocio sea más productivo para ir solventando sus obligaciones familiares.
Los sueños del sr. Luciano son ampliar su negocio y darles a sus hijos estudios universitarios.
texts.en: Luciano has a family formed by his domestic partner and three children. He is responsible in covering all the needs of his family. He works in agriculture, cultivating corn and beans, mainly. He manages this business on his own. He has more than 39 years working in this job. He inherited this job from his family. His work schedule is from six in the morning to two in the afternoon. He will buy insecticides, manure and seeds to improve the harvest of basic grains. He hopes he has everything he needs when winter starts. He hopes that his business is more productive so he can continue paying his family obligations. Luciano's dreams are to expand his business and give his children a college education.

loans.use: to buy insecticides, manure and seeds to improve the harvest of basic grains and be ready with everything he needs when winter starts.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Elsi Noemi

texts.es:
Elsy, se dedica a vender tortillas, criar cerdos y luego los vende para ir teniendo acceso a ingresos importantes para cubrir sus compromisos, el negocio funciona hace ya 5 años, no hay un horario establecido y lo emprendió por iniciativa propia; felizmente comparte su vida con su esposo e hijos.
Invertirá el crédito en la compra de cerdos y concentrado para los mismos, aumentara la capacidad de ventas y los alimentara de manera adecuada, su proyección es continuar en el negocio de porqueriza y estabilizar su situación financiera.
Su visión es lograr tener un negocio más competitivo y reducir las necesidades que surgen en su hogar.
texts.en:
Elsi works selling tortillas, raising pigs and later selling them to have access to significant income to cover her commitments. She has had the business for 5 years now, there isn't a set schedule and she began it with her own initiative. She happily shares her life with her husband and children.

She will invest the loan in the purchase of pigs and concentrated feed for them, she will expand her sales capacity and will feed them appropriately. Her plan is to continue with the pork business and stabilize her financial situation.

Her goal is to manage to have a more competitive business and reduce the needs that come up in her household.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and concentrated feed for them, to increase her sales capacity and feed them appropriately.

loans.name: Josue

texts.es:
Josue tiene 24 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive con su esposa e hijo en casa familiar en una comunidad pequeña en la zona rural del distrito de Lagunas, una comunidad dedicada a la agricultura y comercio que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

El se dedica a la venta de lubricantes y repuestos para motos además a la venta de combustibles, realiza esta actividad desde hace más de 6 meses, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su propio domicilio. Solicita préstamo para la compra de una mayor cantidad de mercadería para incrementar el stock de su negocio, de esta manera el espera hacer crecer más su negocio, obtener más ingresos y poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Josue is 24 years old. He lives with his domestic partner and son in a family house located in a small town of the rural area of the district of  Lagunas, a community dedicated to agriculture and commerce, located in the province of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Perú. 
He works selling motor oils and spare parts for motorcycles, and he also sells fuels. He has worked in this for more than six months. His business is located in his own house. He is requesting a loan to buy a larger amount of merchandise to increase the stock of his business. This way, he hopes to make his business grow and improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy a larger amount of merchandise to increase the stock of his business.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
As a married parent of nine children, Marissa works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from coconut wine vending. Marissa is borrowing PHP 6000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like eggs, junk foods, canned goods, home product care and other groceries for her general store business.

Marissa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 1 loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like eggs, junk foods, canned goods, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Noel

texts.es:
Noel, se mantiene trabajando en el cultivo de granos básicos y jícama, con la ayuda de créditos está haciendo que su negocio sea más rentable, su familia conserva el mismo núcleo y hasta la fecha no representa dificultades para continuar trabajando.
Se aproxima la temporada de siembra y necesita de un crédito para comprar de manera inmediata abono, semilla, herbicidas e insecticidas, para preparar el terreno y llevar a cabo la siembra de granos básicos, espera que la temporada de lluvia sea favorable para obtener abundantes cosechas.
texts.en:
Noel continues working growing basic grains and jícama. With the help of loans, he is making his business more profitable. His family is still the same and to date there haven't been any difficulties to continue working.

Planting season approaches and he needs a loan to immediately purchase manure, seeds, herbicides and insecticides to prepare the land and carry out the planting of basic grains. He hope that the rainy season is favorable to get an abundant harvest.

loans.use: to immediately purchase manure, seeds, herbicides and insecticides to prepare the land and carry out the planting of basic grains.

loans.name: Marcos Vinicio

texts.es: Marcos Vinicio, tiene la edad  de 24 años, está soltero,  vive con sus padres y hermanos, los cuales su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de semilla de frijol de buena calidad y que se adapte bien a las condiciones de la zona y de fertilizantes y otros productos para aplicarle a la siembra y en el desarrollo del cultivo, además pagar mano de obra en la preparacion del terreno y hacer trabajos de consevacion de suelos como lo son las  curvas a nivel y tambien para la aplicación de los productos y asistencia de la plantación una vez que tenga desarrollo, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones que cuenta la zona para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo de granos básicos. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad al igual que una cosecha adecuada, y tener a corto plazo una producción importante. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en el bienestar y estudio de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos eshtatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Marcos Vinicio is 24 years old and lives with his parents and siblings, who are his greatest priority. With the loan, he plans to purchase good quality bean seeds which adapt well to the conditions of the area and fertilizers and other products to apply them to the crop and to the development of the crop. In addition, he will pay labor costs to prepare the land and do soil conservation work such as contour cultivation and also applying the products and assisting the crop once it is developed, and in this way assure himself of doing good work. What he plans to do is to take advantage of the good conditions that the zone has for this crop, and also to implement his various years of experience in dealing with basic grains, in addition to being able to purchase the best products and of the best quality so that his crops develop well and healthily and also produce a fitting harvest, and to have in the short term a significant harvest. With the income of the harvest that he hopes to get, he wants to use it for his family's well-being and education and to achieve some family goals and continue investing more in his crops. This is his first loan that he has gotten from FUDECOSUR. He has never had other loans in state banks before, but FUDECOSUR has offered him a loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to plant beans.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa, who is 46 years old, is a married woman with four children who are all in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Marissa has a food vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 3000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.
