She has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Marissa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 48 years old and is a married woman with four children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

She has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Marites would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for agricultural work, application and incorporation of phytosanitary products, fertilizers and labor costs for his harvest.

loans.name: Nancy Fe

texts.en:
Nancy Fe is 40 years old and married with six children. With three children in school, Nancy Fe works very hard to provide for them.

Nancy Fe runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, beverages, home product care and other groceries.

Nancy Fe has been in this business for 6 years and sells a variety of items such as coffee, household products, noodles, candies and other groceries. 

In the future, Nancy Fe would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, beverages, home product care, etc .. she is saving to send her children to college

loans.name: Nolvia Marina

texts.es: Nolvia, tiene 30 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos que dependen de ella, y reside en una aldea de la Masica, Atlántida junto a sus hijos y sus padres. En busca de obtener ingresos se ha dedicado a la cría y engorde de pollos para vender la carne por libras o pollo entero. Esta actividad la tiene en su casa hace un año y ha visto un crecimiento en su negocio. Esta solicitando 10,000 Lempiras para comprar mas pollos de engorde y aumentar la producción de carne y sus ganancias. Tiene como meta hacer crecer mas su negocio para que su familia tenga bienestar económico.
texts.en: Nolvia is 30 years old, is a single mother, has 3 children who depend on her, and lives in a village in La Masica, Atlántida with her children and her parents. In search of getting an income, she has decided to raise and fatten chickens to sell the meat by the pound or the whole chicken. She has had this business in her house for a year and has seen a growth in the business. She is asking for 10,000 lempiras to purchase more chicks to fatten and increase her meat production and her earnings. She has as a goal growing her business more so that her family has economic well-being.

loans.use: to purchase chicks to raise and fatten and sell the meat.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson, 25, is a smallholder farmer from Wanjengi village who is full of ambition. Wanjengi village is small and located in the Central province of Kenya. This area experiences storms during rainy seasons and extreme temperatures during dry seasons. Farmers in the region have had to adopt different farming techniques and adopt organic animal husbandry practises in order to survive weather conditions lest they lose produce. 

Benson solved feed and milk production challenges brought by weather changes on his dairy farm by introducing animal housing and zero grazing. However, crop failure is still a sad reality caused by lack of water dry seasons. 

Benson seeks approach to dealing with crop failure problem by introducing irrigation on his farm. Introducing irrigation is a big step for rural smallholder farmers because it requires heavy investment on acquiring parts, transporting them to the farm and setting them up, a challenge Benson is willing and ready to take. 

He is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders to purchase an irrigation kit. Benson will spend the loan amount to buy a water tank and pipes.  
This loan will help ensure that Benson's farm stays moist throughout the year and the crops stay green, strong and healthy. Having an irrigation system will help ensure continuous crop production throughout the year which is a step to closing the problem of food insecurity in Kenya. 

Income from this investment will be used by Benson to provide support for his wife and 1 year old child.

loans.use: to buy an irrigation kit of tank and piping to ensure his crops survive in the dry season.  Thus he will be assured of a good harvest

loans.name: Debbie Jane

texts.en:
Debbie Jane is 21 years old and married with one child. Debbie Jane works very hard to provide for them.

Debbie Jane runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Debbie Jane has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap and other groceries. 

In the future Debbie Jane would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell so that can expand her business

loans.name: Melania

texts.es: MELANIA: Es una señora amable, es originaria de la comunidad Bilwaskarma, que se localiza a 12 kilómetros del municipio de Waspam-Rio Coco. Ella pertenece a la etnia Mayagna, tiene 40 años de edad. Casada con 3 hijos: Dos mayores de edad y el menor de 13 años estudia su segundo año de secundaria. Trabaja como docente de educación primaria. Esta solicitando financiamiento para establecer una pequeña pulpería en su vivienda de tambo y madera. Con el préstamo comprara: granos básicos, chiverías, entre otros productos. Ella sueña con tener una casa bonita, con mejores condiciones de seguridad y mejor ambiente para  sus hijos.
texts.en: Melania is a friendly woman, originally from the community of Bilwaskarma, which is located 12 kilometers from the municipality of Waspam-Rio Coco. She belongs to the Mayagna ethnic group, is 40 years old, and married with three children: 2 adults and the youngest is 13 and is in his second year of secondary school. She works as a primary school teacher. She is asking for a loan to establish a small general store in her wooden stilt house. With the loan, she will purchase basic grains, snacks and other products. She dreams of having a pretty house with more secure conditions and a better environment for her children.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, snacks and other products.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a 40 year old farmer from the Kapsowar area of Kenya. He owns a small piece of land which he utilizes by keeping sheep and growing food crops and trees. To make extra income, Patrick is planning to venture into cereal trading business. 

The way cereal trade works is: a trader will aggregate cereal produce in bulk from farmers during harvesting period, when the circulation is high and price is low;then the traders will store, process, package, transport and sell to final consumers when the circulation is low and prices are higher. The difference in buying price and selling price is the traders gross income. He will then deduct all the costs incurred to find his net income. 

Patrick is seeking a loan of KES 30,000 to purchase cereal stock, which he will sell in future at a higher price to make a decent income. 
Your investment will give Patrick an opportunity get start a cereal trade business. If profits are to be made, the money will be rolled back into the business to act as capital. 

Patrick's dream is to grow the start-up into a big business that will bring significant returns.

loans.use: to buy cereals when wholesale prices are low and re-sell at retail when they are higher

loans.name: Triunfadores De Villa Virgen Group

texts.es: La Sra. Irene tiene 43 años de edad, es presidenta de la alcancía comunal “TRIUNFADORES DE VILLA VIRGEN” conformada recientemente por 5 personas muy responsables de la misma zona donde viven y que decidieron trabajar en conjunto para mejorar la calidad de vida que llevan. Irene convive con el Sr. Teodoro con quien tiene 4 hijos pero solo uno aun depende de ellos. Tiene como negocio la confección de pulseras y demás adornos, adicional a ello ayuda en la confección de pantalones en el negocio de su cuñada, así de esta forma Irene apoya en la economía del hogar. El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar materiales y las herramientas que necesita para realizar más pulseras y diferentes adornos para sus clientes. Tiene como anhelo ampliar su negocio, la construcción de su casa y lo más importante, que su hijo sea un profesional de éxito. En la foto grupal Irene se encuentra de pie en medio de las demás personas sentadas.
texts.en: Irene is 43 years old, is the president of the Triunfadores de Villa Virgen communal bank, recently established by 5 very responsible people in the same zone where they live and they decided to work together to improve their quality of life. Irene lives with Teodoro with whom she has 4 children but only one still depends on them. She has as a business making bracelets and other jewelry, in addition to this she helps making pants in her sister-in-law's business. So, in this way, Irene supports the household economy. The loan will be used to purchase materials and equipment that she needs to make more bracelets and different jewelry for her customers. She has as a desire to expand her business, build her house, and more important that her son become a successful professional. In the group photo, Irene is standing in the middle of the other people who are seated.

loans.use: to purchase materials and equipment for her business.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys, a youthful 30-year-old mother, is a wise farmer who is respected by her neighbors and fellow farmers as a mentor. She farms a small plot of land in the green, lush hills of Nyamira, which is in the Nyanza region of Kenya. Gladys is happily married and is blessed with three lovely children. For the past 5 years, she has been involved in mixed farming and she grows maize and vegetables. She also has dairy cows. Gladys has been able to provide nutritious food for her family. She earns profits selling a variety of food crops, but she is faced with a challenge of delivering the produce in a timely manner to the market. 

This challenge has not made her give up and she states: “I have to do something for my family“. Gladys joined Juhudi Kilimo which is a micro finance institution that assists aspiring women like herself. 

She requests a loan from Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders to buy a motorbike and a posho mill. Gladys is from a remote village that has poor roads and transporting her produce to the market has been a challenge. She has suffered many losses of perishable products (milk, vegetables, and tomatoes) which require timely delivery to the market. This loan will help Gladys to achieve her dream and reach her goals. 

Gladys village has no electric posho mill and through this loan she will be able to grind maize and other cereals for her neighbours and also for the entire village which in turn will bring her income. Accessing a financial solution for women in Kenya is an uphill battle but Gladys feels relieved to know that there are institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva that help women to gain respect and equality among their male counterparts. 

The benefits of this loan are astronomical because Gladys will never suffer losses due to delay in delivering produce to the market and also she will get income through the posho mill business. She will increase her sales volume because she will be able to transport more goods to the market. Her income will increase. Gladys is a woman who is making a change for herself and for others in the community because she intends to employ someone to ride the motorbike and help with farm work. Gladys will use the loan to improve her living conditions and assure her children and grandchildren of a secure future.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike and a posho mill for the future welfare of her business and her family

loans.name: Sharqiya

texts.en:
Sharqiya is 35 years old and a married woman, who has two  children. She is an IDP and lives in Bilasuvar IDP Settlement.Sharqiya  has been breeding cattle and cows for the past 12  years. She was a housewife, but her husband is unemployed, and her business helps to cover family needs. 

Sharqiya usually buys small calves, raises and fattens them for 5-6 months, and then resells them for a profitable price in the livestock bazaar. Her monthly income is 220 AZN, and this business is the only source of financial income in her family. Meat is in very high demand in Azerbaijan, and people use it in everyday dishes, like pilau and dolma. She also keeps milking cows for personal use and for selling milk to neighbors. 

She wants to expand her business and improve the life conditions of her family. She applied for a loan of 1500 AZN. She plans to purchase 3 milking cows with her loan funds. This will be her first loan.  Please support her.

loans.use: to purchase 3 milking cows with her loan funds, which will provide an income for her family

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:
Musa is 57 years old, married, and has one child.

Musa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from pig fattening. 

Musa requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Musa aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Lily  is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Arlene

Arlene has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for eight years.

Arlene requested a PHP 29,500 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more boxes of seafood to sell. 

In the future, Arlene would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of seafood to sell.

loans.name: Neli

texts.en:
Neli is 54-year-old widowed woman. She lives with her 2 children and pensioner mother-in-law. Neli works as a babysitter and gets 250 GEL monthly. Her daughter is invalid and gets an invalid pension from the government, which is for medicines. 

Neli wants to open a small shop and increase the family income. She already has commercial space where she is going to open a shop. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan of 1000 USD. With the received credit she will purchase home products and will work there with her daughter. 

The new business initiative will give her chance to get more income and make a better living conditions to her family.

loans.use: to open a small shop with home products, which will help fund her invalid daughter

loans.name: Nhóm 44 - Bình Xuyên Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Le, 36, is a farmer who earns a monthly income of approximately US$ 320. She is married with 2 school-age children. Her family is experiencing economic hardship as both she and her husband are both in bad health conditions and do not have stable jobs. Given these reasons, her family is listed as a poor family. 

They still use a double-pit latrine that has the risks of potential adverse effects on the health of all family members . A portion of Nhóm 44 - Bình Xuyên's loan will help Le as well as two other group members buy materials to build a septic tank toilet to improve the quality of life while also contributing to environmental protection. In the photo, she is pictured first from the left.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a hygienic toilet and a hand-washing device with soap.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in the purchase of popsicles, chocolate covered ice cream cones, ice cream cups, and boxes of ice cream.

Gina requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food-vending business. 

In the future, Gina would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

Eda requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

In the future Eda would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

Donna requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell in her store.

Arlene has been in this business for four years now. 

In the future, Arlene would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like personal product care items, home product care items and other groceries

loans.name: Emelieta
