Emelieta requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of charcoal to resell.

In the future, Emelieta would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina is 51 years old, married, and has eight children, one of whom in school. Dina works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has been in this business for 10 years.

Dina requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, chips, bread, etc.

In the future Dina would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, chips, bread, etc.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is a 54-year-old married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Adelaida has a buy-and-sell firewood business in the Philippines, and she has requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more firewood to sell. She has been in this business for 4 years. 

In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more firewood to sell

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl is a 34-year-old married woman with two children who are still in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Cheryl has a buy-and-sell seafood business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more seafood products to sell like crabs, oysters, shrimp, etc. She has been in this business for 8 years. 

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more seafood products to sell like crabs, oysters, shrimp, etc.

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es: Guillermo, tiene la edad  de 47 años, está casado,  vive con sus hijos y esposa, los cuales su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de semilla de frijol de buena calidad y que se adapte bien a las condiciones de clima, suelo y las cantidad de agua de lluvia que resenta la region  y de fertilizantes y otros productos para aplicarle a la siembra y durante el desarrollo del cultivo, además pagar mano de obra para la aplicación de los productos y asistencia de la plantación una vez que tenga desarrollo, y ademas de asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones que cuenta la zona para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo de granos básicos. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad al igual que una cosecha adecuada, y tener a corto plazo una producción importante. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en el bienestar y estudio de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos eshtatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
47-year old Guillermo is married and lives with his wife and children who are very important to him. With the loan money he will buy high-quality bean seeds that adapt well to the climate, soil, and the high rainfall which falls on the region. He will also buy fertilizer and other products to apply to the beans, hire workers to help in the fields once the beans have developed, and thus ensure a good crop.

Guillermo wishes to take advantage of the good bean-growing conditions of the area, and as well put into practice his several years of experience growing grains. He will be able to buy good  high-quality products and ensure a fine healthy crop resulting in a good harvest. Once the beans are harvested, he hopes to use the income for the wellbeing and education of his family, fulfill some family goals, and continue investing in his fields.

This is Guillermo's first loan with FUDECOSUR. He has not had previous loans with any state banks. FUDECOSUR has provided him with a loan with a much lower interest rate and easy conditions.

loans.use: With his bean fields

loans.name: Joesa

texts.en:
Joesa is thankful that she was granted a 30000 PHP loan which she used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in her general store. Through her earnings she is able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expense. 

She would now like to apply for a 35000 PHP loan which she will use to buy more quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, soda, rice noodles, frozen foods which she sells at retail. She knows that more items in her store will yield more sales and thus increase her earnings. Her income from her store is a stable source to sustain her family's basic needs and for the education of her children. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her. 

Joesa dreams of having a bigger General Store and aims to give her children the best education to allow them better opportunities in life. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study religion, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for groceries, beverages and toiletries to sell, to meet daily living expences

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, coffee and personal care products

loans.name: Soledad

texts.en:
Soledad is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from raising livestock. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more items like canned goods, soft drinks and other groceries.

Soledad has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF, and more recently through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream, which is to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like canned goods, soft drinks and other groceries

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is 50 years old and married with three children, who are in school. Remedios works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of household goods to sell. She has been in this business for 15 years.

In the future, Remedios would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of household goods to sell

loans.name: Magie

texts.en:
Magie works hard to support her family. Magie is single and has a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines.

Magie requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell.

Magie has been in this business for two years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Dorotea

texts.en:
Dorotea is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Dorotea is 60 years old and has one child in school.

Dorotea has a abaca weaving business in the Philippines. Dorotea requested a 15,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy abaca fiber.

Dorotea has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Dorotea would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy abaca fiber

loans.name: Marialyn

texts.en:
Marialyn is 33 years old and married. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Marialyn has a food vending business in the Philippines. Marialyn requested a 10,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Marialyn has been in this business for five years. In the future, Marialyn would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Connie

texts.en:
Connie is 41 years old and married with six children. With three children in school, Connie works very hard to provide for them.

Connie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as canned goods, eggs, biscuits, personal care products and other groceries.

Connie has been in this business for three years now. 

In the future, Connie would like to save enough money so she that can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as canned goods, eggs, biscuits, personal care products and other groceries

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an additional fishing net and other materials for her business

loans.name: Sherlyn

texts.en:
Sherlyn works hard to support her family. Sherlyn is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.

Sherlyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Sherlyn has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Sherlyn would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Wilberth

texts.es: Wilberth, tiene la edad  de 42 años, está casado,  vive con su hijo y esposa, los cuales su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de semilla de frijol de buena calidad y que tenga una alta productividad y ademas que se adapte bien a las condiciones de clima, suelo y las cantidad de agua de lluvia que resenta la region  y tambien de fertilizantes y otros productos para aplicarle a la siembra y durante el desarrollo del cultivo, además pagar mano de obra para la aplicación de los productos y asistencia de la plantación una vez que tenga desarrollo, y ademas de asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones que cuenta la zona para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo de granos básicos. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad al igual que una cosecha adecuada, y tener a corto plazo una producción importante. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en el bienestar y estudio de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos eshtatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
42-year old Wilberth is married and lives with his wife and son who are very important to him. With the loan money he will buy high-quality bean seeds that give a good production. As well they will adapt well to the climate, soil, and the high rainfall which falls on the region. He will also buy fertilizer and other products to apply to the beans, hire workers to help in the fields once the beans have developed, and thus ensure a good crop.

Wilberth wishes to take advantage of the good bean-growing conditions of the area, and as well put into practice his several years of experience growing grains. He will be able to buy good  high-quality products and ensure a fine healthy crop resulting in a good harvest. Once the beans are harvested, he hopes to use the income for the wellbeing and education of his family, fulfill some family goals, and continue investing in his fields.

This is Wilberth's first loan with FUDECOSUR. He has not had previous loans with any state banks. FUDECOSUR has provided him with a loan with a much lower interest rate and easy conditions.

loans.use: With his bean crop

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes es una mujer de 33 años de edad, es casada tiene una linda familia de tres hijos que aún están bajo su cuidado, esta hermosa familia vive en una comunidad de Suchitepéquez.

Mercedes con el afán de obtener sus ingresos y apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa trabaja en oficios domésticos, ella realiza esta labor porque para ella es muy importante su familia.
Mercedes está solicitando  un préstamo, porque tiene la necesidad de construir una pared, y ella no cuenta con el capital necesario, para comprar sus materiales como block, arena y hierro.
Mercedes tiene las esperanzas de conseguir el crédito para poder seguir mejorando su casa.
texts.en:
Mercedes is a thirty-three year-old woman, she is married and has a beautiful family with three children who she still cares for. This lovely family lives in a village in Suchitepéquez. 
Wanting to earn money and support her husband with their household expenses, she does domestic work. She performs this labor because her family is very important to her. 
Mercedes is requesting a loan because she needs to build a wall, but she does not have sufficient capital, to purchase materials like blocks, sand and steel. 
Mercedes hopes to secure the loan so she can continue making improvements to her house.

loans.use: to buy blocks, sand and steel.

loans.name: Valya

texts.en:
Valya lives with her three children, husband, and parents-in-law. She is a farmer who is already highly skilled in animal breeding and land cultivation. Valya, with the help of her husband, keeps two cows, calves and 50 hens. They also cultivate potatoes, carrots, garlic and beans. 

Agriculture helps the family have stable income during the year so it is very important for Valya to enlarge it. She asks this loan to be able to purchase potato seeds, fertilizer and cover cultivation costs.

Because the region where Valya's village is located is considered poor, and the unemployment rate here is very high, people face numerous difficulties in developing their businesses. Valya's loan has been approved within the joint initiative between SEF and Kiva, which provides loans to the underserved population of the Shirak region to help them to access the market and earn a living.

loans.use: to pay for potato seeds, fertilizer and to cover cultivation costs to earn a living

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
José, es un apersona que se dedica a la agricultura y la ganadería, vive con una hermana, estas actividades las desempeña desde hace mucho tiempo y las aprendió con ayuda de su familia, cuenta con experiencia y no se ve que tenga dificultades para seguir trabajando.
Ha solicitado un crédito con la esperanza que sea otorgado ya que lo necesita para comprar abono, semilla, insecticidas y herbicidas, con estos materiales dará un buen desarrollo a su cultivo de maíz, espera que la cosecha sea mayor para poder atender a nuevos clientes e incrementar sus ingresos.
Sus aspiraciones son ampliar sus cultivos y tener mejores ingresos para ir subsistiendo.
texts.en:
José is a person working in agriculture and livestock. He lives with a sister. He has been in this line of work for a long time. He learned the work with the help of his family. He has long time experience and does not see any difficulties regarding continuing working.

He is asking for a loan in the hopes of it being granted as he needs to buy fertilizer, seed, insecticides and herbicides. With these supplies he can have a good corn harvest.  He hopes the crop will allow him to serve new customers and have increased income.

His goal is to expand his crop and have higher profits in order to go on subsisting.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seed, insecticides and herbicides. With these supplies he can have a good corn harvest.

loans.name: Zan's Group

texts.fr: Zan qui se trouve sur la photo au premier rang à gauche, tenant le drapeau de myAgro , est membre d’un groupe de 11 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Falan au sud de Bamako au Mali. Zan, âgée de 50 ans, est la mère de 8 enfants âgés de 3 à 29 ans, dont 4 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés. L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer, mais aussi son mariage avec un agriculteur, ont incité Zan à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 40 ans. Zan cultive l'arachide sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie et d'herbicides. Zan entame sa troisième année avec myAgro, et s'est réinscrite en raison de la perspective de pouvoir augmenter son rendement à travers les services proposés par myAgro et de la conviction des agents myAgro sur les bénéfices apportés par la méthode myAgro. Cette année Zan effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.125 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 10 ans que Zan cultive l'arachide pour sa valeur commerciale, car l’arachide est un aliment qu’elle vend sur le marché et aussi pour sa rentabilité productive et marchande. Zan planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  de faire de l'élevage  et de pouvoir faire du commerce. Enfin Zan espère aussi pouvoir couvrir les frais scolaires des enfants ainsi qu'assurer l'autosuffisance alimentaire de la famille.
texts.en:
Zan is sitting in the front row in the photo, holding the myAgro flag.  She is a member of a group of eleven farmers who work with the field partner, myAgro.  The group lives and works in the village of Falan, south of Bamako, in Mali.  

Zan is 50 years old and mother to eight children aged between three and twenty-nine years old.  Four of her children currently attend school.  The primary source of income and provision of food for the family comes from agriculture as Zan's husband is also a farmer.  Zan has been working in this business for forty years.  She grows peanuts and has to cope with problems such as lack of rain and shortage of herbicides.

Zan has been working with myAgro for three years to increase her harvest and benefit from the services offered by myAgro.  This year, Zan is buying fertilizer to improve the harvest from her 0.125 hectare plot of land.  Zan has been growing peanuts for ten years because it is a profitable crop.

Zan plans to use her increased earnings to continue her business and start raising livestock.  She hopes to be able to afford school fees for her children and to provide for the food needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to grow peanuts.

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura is 33 years old and she lives at her parent's house, from where she cooks and sells Bolivian dishes.  She prepares the food and takes it to public offices. She doesn't have a restaurant, so she has to go to many places and that is something hard for her.  

She needs a loan to buy groceries, soft drinks and other things for her food business.  Laura works hard because many Bolivian women earn money by selling all types of food, so she hopes you can help her. She is single and she doesn't have children and she takes care of her parents because they are retired, so sometimes their money is not enough to support the household.

Laura would like to have her own restaurant in the future.  In the picture Laura appears at the place where she cooks the food, located at her parent's house

loans.use: to buy groceries, soft drinks and other things for her food business, which helps support her elderly parents

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Mary Jean works hard to support her family.

Mary Jean has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a restaurant. Mary Jean is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell in her store.

Mary Jean has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell in her store

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is a married woman with three children. Margie is 34 years old and has three children are currently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Margie has a fishing business in the Philippines. Margie requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy an additional fish net, gasoline for her boat and other materials for her business.

Margie has been in this business for six years. She would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy an additional fish net, gasoline for her boat and other materials for her business

loans.name: Eleonor

texts.en:
Eleonor is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Eleonor is 35 years old and has two children who are in school.

Eleonor has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy abaca fiber and other materials.

Eleonor has been in this business for five years. In the future, Eleonor would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy abaca fiber and other materials

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 27 years old and married with one child.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Jennifer is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines for her pigs.

Jennifer has been raising pigs for six years and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Glenda Marilu

texts.es:
Glenda, ha mejorado significativamente su negocio de venta de ropa y cosméticos con la administración adecuada del préstamo anterior, cuenta con clientes satisfechos y su familia tiene mejores circunstancias de vida.
Está haciendo la solicitud de un nuevo préstamo para invertir en prendas de vestir y ropa interior para ambos sexo, surtirá su negocio para mantenerlo activo y seguir teniendo clientes satisfechos.
texts.en: Glenda has significantly improved her clothing and cosmetics business with the right management of her previous loan. She has satisfied customers and her family has better quality of life. She is asking for a new loan to buy clothing and underwear for both men and women. She will supply her business to keep it active and to continue having satisfied clients.

loans.use: invertir en prendas de vestir y ropa interior para ambos sexo, surtirá su negocio para mantenerlo activo y seguir teniendo clientes satisfechos

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Felixberta

texts.en:
Felixberta is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Felixberta is 60 years old.

Felixberta has a abaca weaving business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy abaca fiber.

Felixberta has been in this business for 15 years.  In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy abaca fiber

loans.name: Zhuleta

texts.en:
Zhuleta, her mother-in-law and her 28-year-old son live in Geghanist, a village of the Masis region. Her husband is a migrant worker in a neighbouring country, working hard to sustain his family's living. 

Zhuleta, to help her husband with the family's daily expenses and earn an income, has been involved in agriculture for many years. 
She keeps livestock (cows, calves, pigs and hens) and also cultivates wheat, barley, potatoes and carrots. Her son works as a construction worker and her mother-in-law is ninety years old elderly retired woman, so Zhuleta  besides her work in the farm, also has to take care of the household and family members.
 
Because the region where Zhuleta's village is located is considered poor, and the unemployment rate here is very high, people face numerous difficulties in developing their businesses. Zhuleta's loan has been approved within the joint initiative between SEF and Kiva, which provides loans to the under-served population of the Shirak region to help them to access the market and earn a living.

loans.use: to pay for two piglets and ox, as well as to cover cultivation costs to enlarge the farm and earn a living for the family

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth works hard to support her family. Janeth is married and has a tailoring business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials like thread, needles, etc., to use.

Janeth has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Janeth would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like thread, needles, etc., to use

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 59 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell. She has been in this business for nine years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Corazon aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 43 years old and has four children. Jennifer is married, and three of her children are in school.

Jennifer is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Jennifer requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Jennifer has been in this business for one year now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jennifer would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 46 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Jocelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like junk food, eggs, canned goods, home care products and other groceries.

She has been in this business for 10 years now. 

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like junk food, eggs, canned goods, home care products and other groceries

loans.name: Poline

texts.en:
Meet Poline, a diligent rural dairy farmer from Mugwe village in Central Kenya. Poline owns a 2.65 acre farm where she farms and lives with her husband and three children. Two of her children are in boarding schools, making school fees her single biggest annual expense. She has been able to rely on farming for the last 20 years as a source of income. 

Poline is seeking a KES 93,200 loan to purchase a good quality dairy cow. She already has 9 heads of poultry. Poline also grows tea, bananas and vegetables. 

With your loan investment, the additional cow is estimated to create a 40% increase in the volume of milk production on her farm. Additional income from this investment will enable her to repay the loan and invest more in her business. Help her out!

loans.use: To buy a quality dairy cow for a 40% increase in milk production which helps with boarding school fees for her children

loans.name: Minko's Group

texts.fr: Minko qui se trouve sur la photo assit au premier rang à droite, est membre d’un groupe de 8 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de M'Piebougou au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Minko, âgée de 46 ans, est la mère de 8 enfants âgés de 10 à 25 ans, Minko, âgée de 46 ans, est la mère de 8 enfants âgés de 10 à 25 ans, et dont l'un d’entre eux est actuellement scolarisé. L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer a incité Minko à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 35 ans. Minko cultive l'arachide, le maraichage sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie, de matériels agricoles et d'engrais de qualité. Minko entame sa deuxième année avec myAgro, et s'est reinscrite en raison du système de paiement et des semences de qualité, ainsi que des formations et techniques agricoles. Cette année Minko effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.125 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 35 ans que Minko cultive l'arachide pour sa valeur vivrière, expliquant que l’arachide est directement consommable par la famille et est utilisée comme sauce de base dans l’alimentation et aussi pour avoir l'autosuffisance alimentaire. Minko planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  de faire de l'élevage comme et d'acheter du matériel agricole comme . Enfin Minko espère aussi pouvoir couvrir les frais scolaires des enfants ainsi que financer le mariage de ses enfants
texts.en:
Minko, who is sitting in the photo in the first row on the right, is a member of a group of eight farmers registered with myAgro, who live and work in the village of M'Piebougou in the southeast of Bamako, Mali. 

Minko, aged 46, is the mother of eight children aged between 10 and 25, of whom one is presently in school. The fact that agriculture is the anchor of family tradition, principle source of income and of food self-sufficiency for the household, moved Minko to work in this field for 35 years now. Minko grows peanuts and market vegetables on her plot but as a farmer she has to face difficulties such as a lack of rain, of agricultural materials, and of high-quality fertilizer.  

Minko is beginning her second year with myAgro and registered for a second time because of the system of payment and the high-quality seeds, as well as the training and agricultural techniques. This year Minko is making payments to buy myAgro's package of fertilizer so as to increase her yield on her plot of  0.125 hectare. She has been cultivating peanuts for 35 years for their nutritive value, explaining that peanuts are immediately edible by the family and are used as a base for sauces in cooking, and also to have food self-sufficiency. 

With the increase in her crop yield and her income, Minko plans to raise livestock and buy herself agricultural materials. Finally, Minko also hopes to be able to cover school fees for the children and have enough money for her children's weddings.

loans.use: to buy herself a fertilizer package for growing peanuts

loans.name: Maglena

texts.en:
Maglena is 40, a married mother of two teenage children; 18 and 15 years old, with the oldest one studying in an Islamic high school, including living in the dorm, in the city of Korca. Since living is in the dorm, there are some fees for it, unlike other public high schools here in Albania. Students study all the subjects that they would learn in public schools with the only difference, studying the faith in detail being added to the curriculum.
 
Maglena is asking your financial help to pay for the fees of her daughter.  She has been raising livestock for the past 15 years.  She’s gets cows and sells their raw milk to dairy farms and plants food for the animals and for the family as well. In addition to all these, she runs a little store, where she has been photographed, from her home.

loans.use: to pay for her daughters education/dormitory fees

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy and export more scrap metal.

loans.name: Javeiro

texts.es:
Javeiro tiene 20 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa familiar con su cónyuge y su hijo en el distrito de Oyotún, la cual es una zona rural dedicada a la agricultura y comercio que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

El se dedica a brindar servicio de jornalería como peón agrícola, realiza esta actividad desde hace 08 años por lo que cuenta con experiencia en este negocio y con buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito. Solicita préstamo para la compra de herramientas como son tablas, burros, etc. para realizar su trabajo, esto con la finalidad de brindar mejores servicio a sus clientes lo que incrementará su nivel de ingresos y por ende va a mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Javier is twenty years old, he lives with his partner and his son in their home in the Oyotún district, which is a rural area dedicated to agriculture and commerce located in Chiclayo province, in the Lambayeque region on Peru's northern coast. 
He works as a day laborer as a farm hand, he has been doing this for eight years so he has experience at this work and has very good personal and professional references in his area. He is soliciting a loan to buy materials such as wooden planks, workhorses, etc. for his work, with the goal of providing better services to his customers, which will increase his earnings and ultimately improve his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as wooden planks and sawhorses for his work.

loans.name: Carmela

texts.en:
Carmela is single, and she works hard to support herself.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from charcoal retailing. Carmela is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell for her general store business.

Carmela has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF, and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is 72 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for the family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, coffee, etc.

Juanita has been in this business for 20 years.

In the future, Juanita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Agustina

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Agustina works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from personal products.  

Agustina is borrowing PHP 27,000 through NWTF in order to purchase an additional stock of groceries to sell.

Agustina has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase an additional stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ronaly

texts.en:
Ronaly is 42 years old and married with one child; she works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like soap, shampoo, chips, bread, canned goods, soft drinks, etc.

Ronaly has been in this business for nine years.  She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. 

In the future Ronaly would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like soap, shampoo, chips, bread, canned goods, soft drinks, etc

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 51 years old and has four children. She is married and has three children who are in school.

Juliet is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Juliet requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

She has been in this business for three years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Juliet would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Leonisa

texts.en:
As a parent of three children, Leonisa works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Leonisa is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Leonisa has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Alenie

texts.en:
Alenie is 37 years old and married with three children. With three children still in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Alenie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell such as canned goods, noodles, spices, coffee, milk and other personal care products.

Alenie has been in this business for three years. 

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell such as canned goods, noodles, spices, coffee, milk and other personal care products

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 46 years old and has four children. She is married and has two children who are in school.

Jocelyn is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Jocelyn has been in this business for four years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely is 62 years old and married with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Fely has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

Fely has been in this business for eight years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Fushai Group

texts.en:
Faith is a member of the Fushai group, meaning to preserve in the local language.  She is a widowed mother of 4 children, with two going to school and lives in Warren Park, Harare. Faith together with her other group members joined Thrive in February 2015 and they received business advice which they said were very helpful to them since they learned different business principles such as the importance of saving and record keeping. 

Faith has a small poultry business. She produces 100 chickens after every 4 weeks.  She says she is very serious and passionate with her business, which started 2 years ago with batches of 50 chickens every 6 weeks and this shows that her business is growing.

Faith and her other group members have applied for a combined loan of USD1750 and she said she wants to use her portion of the loan amount to increase her number of chickens from 100 to 200 per batch after every 4 weeks, as she is facing an increase in the demand  of chickens from surrounding small restaurants. 

Faith also said she is making some savings in her personal savings account which she wants to use to buy a small plot in the outskirts of the town for her business since she is currently operating at home and she thinks this will allow her to operate on a larger scale and start supplying larger restaurants with chickens.

loans.use: To increase her stock of broiler chickens which are supplied in increasing numbers to local restaurants.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a piece of land to expand his successful farm and increase his profits. He wishes to ensure a good future for his children.

loans.name: Mirian Jessica

texts.es:
Mirian tiene 31 años de edad, es separada, tiene 3 hijos, vive con su familia en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

Mirian se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales como patos, gallos, gallinas, pollos, cuyes, entre otros; tiene más de 10 años de experiencia en el negocio, el mismo que está ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio. Solicita préstamo para compra de una cantidad mayor de animales para su negocio, dicha inversión le servirá para tener mayor variedad y productividad en animales, con gran influencia en el negocio; Mirian Jessica piensa incrementar su stock de animales para poder atender los diversas gustos y necesidades de los clientes de la zona, lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Mirian Jessica is 31 years old, separated from her husband, and has three children. She lives with her family in a rural area in the Oyotun district, Chiclayo province. Her community mainly earns a living in agriculture, raising cattle, and in business.

Mirian works at raising and selling animals, such as ducks, roosters, chickens, guinea pigs and others. She has been working at this business for more than 10 years, and it is located at the back at her home. 

Mirian Jessica is asking for a loan to buy a larger number of animals for her business. This purchase will allow her to have a greater variety and productivity from the animals, which will have a great influence on her business. 

Mirian Jessica plans to increase her stock of animals in order to be able to meet different preferences and needs among her customers in the area. This will allow her to increase her income in a short time, improve her earnings, and thus improve the quality of life for herself and for her family.

loans.use: to buy a larger number of animals for her business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives in Muiru village, situated in the Chuka area of Kenya. Land in Muiru is extremely fertile for agriculture. Most families in Muiru practice agriculture. Mary, and her husband, own a small piece of land in this region. They live together with their lovely 3 children. They have been doing dairy farming for the last twenty years to earn a living. Her primary income source is milk, poultry and crop farming.

Mary is seeking a loan to buy cereals for resale. As her children grow older, their upkeep and educational expenses keep rising. In order to meet these needs, Mary needs to boost her cereal selling business. With your loan, she will be able to sell her cereals to both her neighbours and the local market. She will use the additional income from cereal sales to pay the loan installments and, later on, school fees. All she waits for is your kindness.

loans.use: To buy cereals wholesale for resale at retail prices, to help support her family

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Letecia works hard to support her family. She has a fruit vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling fire wood.  

Letecia is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy more fruit to sell like bananas, etc. for her fruit vending business.

Letecia has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell like bananas etc.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 59 years old and has seven children. She is a married woman.

Letecia is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

She has been in this for three years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Letecia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Phumulani Group

texts.en:
Early morning at 4am, three buses full of Zimbabwean traders arrive at Johannesburg park station- forced to travel by high prices back home. In one of the buses, a young woman named Lynn sleeps huddled up in her blanket and awaits the opening of shops. Soon there is a noisy discussion, as fellow Zimbabweans who fled the economic hardship, enquire about the situation back home. Some of the vendors and shopkeepers know Lynn as their regular customer who buys an assortment of goods to resale back home in Harare.

Lynn is a law student at a local University who runs a flea market business in one of the busy suburbs of  Harare. She demonstrates sharp business skills by building a solid relationship with her customers. At times, she imports some products from China and delivers them door to door, in order to know her customers and provide a distinguished service. 

The 23-year-old woman is a member of Phumulani (which means “Rest” in Ndebele, a Zimbabwean dialect). Their focus is to grow their businesses and supply a potentially large market with their products. Lynn hopes that a loan from Kiva will help her import unique products from China, which are in demand and also help their group expand their businesses.

loans.use: To increase her stock of imported clothes and household goods for sale.

loans.name: Zvart

texts.en:
Zvart lives in Panik village with her 91-years-old and elderly retired father-in-law. Her only son and daughter-in-law left their motherland, and currently work and live in a neighbouring country, with the hope of finding a bright future for their children.
 
Zvart, to sustain her living runs her farm. She cultivates barley, potatoes and carrots and currently doesn't keep animals, because the barn which she owns is very old. She asks this loan to be able to renovate the barn and start animal husbandry keeping as well.  Zvart also plan to use the loan in purchasing potato seeds and fertilizer, so her farming business is enlarged.
 
Because the region where Zvart's village is located is considered poor, and the unemployment rate there is very high, people face numerous difficulties in developing their businesses. Zvart's loan has been approved within the joint initiative between SEF and Kiva, which provides loans to the under-served population of the Shirak region to help them to access the market and earn a living.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of the old barn and for potato seeds and fertilizer needed in the development of the farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase books, book covers, pencils, paper, etc. to supply the bookstore, and to maintenance the equipment he uses to keep the radio station on the air.

loans.name: Esfuerzo Es Exito Group

texts.es: Sheila tiene 37 años de edad es soltera con 02 hijos dependientes. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y accesorios para damas en una galería. Y a la vez vende zapatos y zapatillas.  El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de más ropa de estación de invierno chompas casacas gorras chalinas. Ella participa en el grupo “ESFUERZO ES ÉXITO”. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Sheila es la primera del lado derecho viste polo plomo.
texts.en:
Sheila, age 37, is single and has two dependent children.  She sells women’s clothes and accessories at a shopping area.  She also sells shoes and slippers.

She will use the loan to buy more winter clothes, sweaters, jackets, hats, and scarves.  

She is a member of the Esfuerzo Es Éxito group.  The group is grateful to the Kiva lenders for the loan that was granted.  She is the first one on the right wearing a gray shirt.

loans.use: to buy more winter clothes.

loans.name: Cayetana

texts.en:
Cayetana is a married woman with five children. Cayetana is 47 years old and has two children who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Cayetana has a fishing business in the Philippines. Cayetana requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Cayetana has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Cayetana would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Fifteen years ago Elizabeth started farming on a small inherited piece of land in Shamatia, a remote village in the Ndaragwa area of Kenya. Today, this humble mother of two children sells milk, eggs and a variety of food crops. She is a passionate farmer and, because of the immense knowledge she has on farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village. Dairy farming is close to her heart and every day she wakes up to milk her cow and that makes her very proud. 

Although she makes profits through milk selling, she lacks a proper dairy unit and she is seeking a loan to build a modern dairy unit. Through the loan she will have a humble time milking her cow and also feeding. A good dairy unit provides a good place where cows can relax and also prevent them from diseases that may arise because of being exposed to harsh weather conditions such as rain. Elizabeth believes that through this loan her living conditions will change because she is going to have an increase in milk production. 

She will save money that she used to spend on treating her cows because she lacked a good dairy unit. Elizabeth waits for your kindness.

loans.use: To build a modern dairy unit for the benefit of her cows and to increase milk production

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es: Silvia: Es una señora luchadora de 52 años de edad, originaria de la comunidad Bilwaskarma, que se localiza a 12 kilómetros del municipio de Waspam-Rio Coco. Ella pertenece a la etnia Mayagna. Madre soltera de 8 hijos: 6 mayores de edad y la 2 que estudian su carrera universitaria. Cuenta con una experiencia de más de dos décadas de ser docente de educación primaria de la comunidad de Klar Rio Coco Abajo. Con el crédito anterior otorgado por PANA PANA y financiado por KIVA, le permitieron mejorar el techo de su vivienda. Esta solicitando financiamiento para terminar de construir la estatura externa de su vivienda de tambo y madera. Ella sueña con construir el área para cocina en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Silvia is a fighter of a woman.  She is 52 years old and comes form the Bilwaskarma community, which is 12 kilometers from the Waspam-Rio Coco municipality.  She is ethnically Mayagna. She is a single mother to 8 children, 6 are adults and 2 are studying for their university degrees.  

She has more than 2 decades of experiencia as a primary education teacher at the Klar Rio Coco Abajo community.  The previous loan from PANA PANA and financed by KIVA allowed her to fix the roof of her house.  She is requesting additional financing to finish the external structure of her stilt and wood house.  She dreams of building a kitchen in her house.

loans.use: to finish building the external portion of her stilt and wood home.

loans.name: Bella

texts.en:
Bella is 22 years old and married with one child. Bella works very hard to provide for them.

Bella runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, spices, noodles, etc.

Bella has been in this business for two years. 

Bella would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, spices, noodles, etc

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 49 years old, married and has one child.

Gemma is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. Gemma requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

Gemma has been in this business for four years now.

Gemma would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Anxhela

texts.en:
Anxhela is a married mother of a 7 and 3 years-old-child and they live in a village in southeastern Albania. The only source of income for their family has been the agriculture/livestock since she got married. 

Mostly she has orchards with apples and cherries and sells the fruits to wholesalers.  The region of Korca where she resides is known for producing the largest quantity and the tastiest apples and cherries in Albania.  These products usually are exported to neighboring former Yugoslavian countries.  

Anxhela also plants fodder for feeding her two dairy cows and the horse she uses it for transportation. From the cows, she sells about liters of milk a day during their production months that are roughly nine months/year until they get pregnant. 

Your loan will help her build some pillars of cement inside the plantation.

loans.use: to build some cement pillars inside the orchard of apples and cherries

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to expand her timber supply business with a new warehouse for storage

loans.name: Raylen

texts.en:
Raylen is 32 years old and married with four children. With three children in school, Raylen works very hard to provide for them.

Raylen runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stock to sell.

Raylen has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, diapers and other groceries. 

In the future, Raylen would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Gina

texts.en:
Ma. Gina is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ma. Gina is 45 years old and has two children who are in school.

Ma. Gina has a buy & sell firewood business in the Philippines. Ma. Gina requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more firewood to sell.

Ma. Gina has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Ma. Gina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more firewood to sell.

loans.name: Christy

texts.en:
Christy is 29 years old and married. She has one child who is in school. 

Christy is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Christy requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Christy has been raising pigs for seven years now and has borrowed ten times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Christy would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
Ligaya is 58 years old, married and has seven children.

Ligaya is in the agricultural business, pig-fattening in the Philippines. Ligaya requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

Ligaya has been in this business for 4 years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Cristy Joy

texts.en:
Cristy Joy is 27 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. Cristy Joy works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Cristy Joy has been in this business for 3 years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries.

loans.name: Lush

texts.en:
Lush is a villager and a married father of three, ranging in age from 17 to 22 years old and they live in northern Albania. Lush wants to expand the existing stable of his animals and your loan will be used for this purpose.
 
Livestock has been his family’s source of income for years now; he has been adding slowly dairy cows with two of them from a very good breed. " I love animals and doing livestock is not just income, as love I have for them as well," said Lush to the branch assistant who took part of his interview. So far, he has seven cows in total, with 5 baby calves. 

In the farm, he plants only food for the animals. All in all, he sells roughly five calves a year and about 100 liters of raw milk a day for most of the year until the cows become heavily pregnant then they cannot be milked any longer due to the fact that the milk turns out bitter and not healthy.

loans.use: to expand the existing stable for cows; currently there are 7 cows and 5 calves

loans.name: Stephanie Lizbeth

texts.es: STEPHANIE LIZBETH: Es una mujer luchadora, originaria de Waspam, madre soltera de 1 hijo de 4 años de edad. Trabaja como educadora comunitaria. Con el propósito de construir su vivienda de concreto está solicitando su primer financiamiento para comprar: cemento, hierro y alambre. Ella sueña con tener una casa bonita, con mejores condiciones de seguridad y mejor ambiente para  su hijo.
texts.en: Stephanie Lizbeth is a woman with a fighting spirit, a native of Waspam, and a single mother with a four-year-old son.  She works as a community educator. For the purpose of building her home of concrete, she is requesting her first loan, to purchase cement, iron, and wire. She dreams of having a pretty house with safer conditions, and a better environment for her son.

loans.use: to purchase cement, iron, and wire.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in: galvanized sheet metal, wood, nails, and wire to place a roof over the washroom and concrete cistern.

loans.name: Rosendo

texts.es:
Rosendo tiene 42 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive con su esposa y sus 3 hijos en el distrito de Callayuc, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y crianza de animales que se encuentra ubicada en la región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

El se dedica al cultivo de café, cuenta con 10 años de experiencia en este negocio y con buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito. El préstamo lo utilizará para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo de café, con esto Rosendo espera mejorar la calidad del café que ofrece a sus clientes lo que incrementará su nivel de ingresos y por ende va a mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Rosendo is 42 years old and in a civil union. He lives with his spouse and their 3 children in the Callayuc district, a community dedicated to agriculture, commerce, and animal-raising that is located in the Cajamarca region, in the north mountains of Peru.  

He makes a living cultivating coffee.  He has 10 years of experience in the business and has good personal and professional references in the district.  He will use the loan to buy compost and fertilizer to give good maintenance to his coffee plants.  Rosendo hopes that with this assistance, the quality of his coffee will improve and will increase his income and allow him to give a better quality of life to his family.

loans.use: to buy compost and fertilizer to maintain his coffee plants.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is 27 years old and married. She has two children.  

Jessica is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Jessica requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Jessica has been raising pigs for nine years now and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Jessica would like to save enough to support the financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 33 years old and married with two children, both of whom are in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Marivic is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Marivic has been raising pigs for ten years and also earns additional income from personal products.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream which is to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Sonie

texts.en:
As a married parent of eleven children, Sonie works hard to support her family.

She has a furniture making business in the Philippines. Sonie is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials like wood, paints, nails, etc to use for her furniture making business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. 

Sonie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like wood, paints, nails, etc to use in furniture making.

loans.name: Nelsie

texts.en:
Nelsie is 46 years old and married. She has four children, three of whom are in school.

She is in the agricultural business, farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Nelsie requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and pay laborers' salaries for cleaning the farm.

Nelsie has been farming sugarcane for 16 years now and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Nelsie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pay laborers' salaries for cleaning the farm.

loans.name: Ma. Lany

texts.en:
Ma. Lany is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ma. Lany is 48 years old and has three children who are in school.

Ma. Lany has a food vending business in the Philippines. Ma. Lany requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Ma. Lany has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Ma. Lany would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Anelia

texts.en:
Anelia is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Anelia is 41 years old and has three children still in school.

Anelia has a weaving business in the Philippines. Anelia requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy pineapple leaves and other materials for her business.

Anelia has been in this business for 3 years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy pineapple leaves and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Angeles

texts.en:
Angeles works hard to support her family. Angeles is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Angeles has been in this business for 30 years now.

In the future, Angeles would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 58 years old and married with five children. Gloria works very hard to provide for them.

Gloria runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, milk, spices, drinks, bread, etc.

Gloria has been in this business for 5 years.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, milk, spices, drinks and bread.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is 63 years old, a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Estrella has a fruit-vending business in the Philippines. Estrella requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more fruits to sell on her fruit stand.

Estrella has been in this business for 18 years. In the future, Estrella would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits to sell on her fruit stand.

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina is 41 years old, married, and has three children, one of whom attends school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Dina has a fruit vending business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 15 years.

Dina requested a loan from NWTF for 15,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more fruits to sell in her food stall. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits to sell

loans.name: Marites

texts.en: Marites is single with one child. She works hard to support her family. For seven years, she has been buying and selling citrus fruit in the Philippines. Marites requested a 28,000 PHP loan through Kiva's partner, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, to buy more citrus fruits to sell in her stall. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more citrus fruits to sell in her stall

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en: Amalia is 58 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them. She has run a general store in the Philippines for six years. Amalia requested a 23,000 PHP loan through Kiva's partner, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, to purchase items to sell such as shampoo and groceries to sell. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy works hard to support her family. Joy is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Joy requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

Joy has been in this business for 12 years now.

In the future, Joy would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Perlina

texts.en:
Perlina is 57 years old and married with six children. Perlina works very hard to provide for them.

Perlina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

Perlina has been in this business for 10 years. 

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Helen is 43 years old and has one child who is in school.

Helen has a bakery business in the Philippines. Helen requested a PHP 16000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her bakery.

Helen has been in this business for three years. In the future, Helen would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her bakery

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 52 years old and married with four children. Nenita works very hard to provide for them.

Nenita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, home product care and other groceries.

Nenita has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items such as biscuits, biscuits, coffee, milk, candles and other groceries. 

In the future, Nenita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, home product care and other grocceries

loans.name: Vicky

texts.en:
Vicky is 48 years old, married, and has four children, two of whom attend school. She works very hard to provide for them. Vicky operates a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for two years. 

Vicky requested a loan from NWTF for 5,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase more groceries to sell. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel is 42 years old and has three children. Raquel is married and has three children who are still in school.

Raquel is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Raquel requested a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Raquel has been in this business for 3 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.name: Roberto Augusto

texts.es:
Roberto es un joven que vive junto a su madre y a sus 9 hermanos (3 hombres y 6 mujeres). Su padre falleció hace algunos años. Su madre es ama de casa motivo por el cual, sus hermanos y Roberto, tienen que buscar la manera de trabajar para apoyar a su madre. La situación económica por la cual están atravesando es muy crítica, por la falta de trabajo.

Pero Roberto aún así, no piensa dejar de estudiar ya que su carrera de Electrónica Industrial, le permitirá generar mayores y mejores ingresos porque es una de las carreras más rentables en la actualidad. Él siente que lo beneficiará bastante ya que podría adquirir un negocio familiar y así ayudar a su madre que tanto lo necesita.

Él empezó a trabajar desde los 19 años para poder apoyar a su madre con los pagos de sus estudios, pero la situación cada vez se hace más complicada. Debido a ello, recurre a KIVA para que lo puedan apoyar, porque de no tener el préstamo le afectaría muchísimo, tendría que dejar sus estudios y buscar un trabajo que le permita reunir el dinero necesario para retomar sus clases.

Roberto, les dice a la gente de KIVA: "Nunca pierdan las esperanzas para todo y menos para estudiar. Siempre hay una alternativa y en este caso el apoyo de KIVA es muy beneficioso. Muchas gracias KIVA por su gran apoyo, porque sin su ayuda yo podría terminar mi carrera y convertirme en gran profesional."
texts.en:
Roberto is a young man that lives with his mother and his 9 siblings (3 brothers and 6 sisters).  His father died a few years ago. His mother is a housewife, which is why Roberto and his siblings need to find a way to work to help their mother.  They are in a critical economic situation due to lack of work.  

Even so, Roberto didn't think of stopping his studies in Industrial Electronics. which will allow him to generate greater and more quality income because it is currently a very profitable career.  He feels it will benefit him to have a family business and in this way help his mother, who needs the help.  

He began working at age 19 to help his mother with the payments for his education, but the economic situation was increasingly complicated.  This led his to KIVA to seek help, because not having the loan would affect him dramatically, he would have to stop studying and find a job that would allow him to save enough money to retake the classes.  

Roberto says to the people of KIVA:  "Never lose hope for anything, especially studying.  There is always an alternative and in this case the help of KIVA is very beneficial.  Thanks to KIVA for the great help, because without it I couldn't finish my studies and become a professional."

loans.use: to pay the debts and successfully finish his degree in industrial electronics.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel es un hombre de 37 años de edad, es casado tiene una linda familia de cuatro hijos de las edades entre 8 y 12 años, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de San Andrés Semetabaj.
Manuel con el afán de generar sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia se dedica a la siembra de arveja china, el realiza esta labor desde hace 10 años.
Manuel ahora necesita de un poco más de capital pues no cuenta con suficiente dinero para poder cultivar sus cuerdas de arveja, por tal razón solicita un crédito para poder comprar sus semillas, fertilizantes.
El gran sueño de Manuel es conseguir este crédito para poder sembrar en esta temporada y construirles una casa a cada uno de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Manuel is 37 years old. He is married and has a beautiful family with four children between the ages of 8 and 12. This humble family lives in the San Andrés Semetabaj community.

In an effort to generate income and raise his family, Manuel is in the business of planting of snow peas. He has performed this work for 10 years.

Now Manuel needs a little more capital because he does not have enough money to cultivate his strings of peas. He is requesting a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers.

Manuel 's biggest dream is to acquire the loan for planting this season and to build a house for each of his children.

loans.use: buy pea seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Jose Ismael

texts.es:
José, vive con su pareja con quien está felizmente casado, y tienen hijos menores de edad, son una familia unida y trabajadora, así lo expresan sus vecinos; don José se dedica a los trabajos agrícolas y a ofrecer el servicio de albañil, su negocio inicio con poco equipo y no tenía muchos clientes, con esfuerzos ha logrado ampliarlo y ganar nuevos clientes que prefieren sus servicios, el trabajo en el campo lo hace solo, cuenta que en época seca utiliza sistema de regadío para que las cosechas de granos básicos sean abundantes, sus labores las desempeña con un horario de ocho de la mañana a cinco de la tarde.
Invertirá en la siembra de maíz adquiriendo abono, semilla y fertilizantes, también podrá pagar el alquiler del terreno para realizar la siembra, espera saber administrar el crédito en su negocio para que las cosechas sean abundantes así abastecer a su familia de alimentación y otra parte para vender más  y generar nuevas ganancias.
Su visión es tener nuevos contratos para desempeñar trabajos de albañilería, seguir trabajando en el campo y tener mejor calidad de vida familiar.
texts.en:
José lives with his spouse with whom he is happily married and they have young children. They are a united and hard working family according to their neighbors. José is dedicated to farming work and offering his services as a mason. His business started with little equipment and he didn't have many customers. With his effort, he has managed to expand it and earn new customers who prefer his services. He performs his farm work alone. He tells us that in the dry season he uses an irrigation system so his grain harvests are abundant so he can provide food for his family and also sell more and earn new income.

His vision is to have new contracts for masonry work, to keep working on the farm and to have a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to invest in the planting of maize acquiring fertilizer and seeds and also to pay to rent the land on which he'll plant.

loans.name: Flaviana

texts.en:

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Flaviana is borrowing PHP 11000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Flaviana has been farming vegetables for 23 years and also earns additional income from general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies to save money for sending her children to college

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Maria tiene 46 años de edad, vive con su esposo en el distrito de Cayaltí, una zona donde se dedican al cultivo de caña, arroz, comercio de animales menores, ubicada a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Junto a su familia se dedican a la crianza de animales menores, gallinas, patos, cerdos, su negocio está ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio. Ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de animales pequeños y posteriormente ofrecerlos a un mejor precio a sus clientes, esto le generará mayores ingresos para su familia y le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria is 46 years old and lives with her husband in the district of Cayaltí, an area which is dedicated to the cultivation of sugarcane, rice, and the trade of small animals. It is located two hours from the city of Chiclayo, which is located in the region of Lambayeque on the northern coast of Peru.

Together with her family they make a living raising small animals such as chickens, ducks and pigs. Her business is located in the back of their home. She has requested a loan for the purchase of small animals to then offer a better price to her customers, which will generate a higher income for her family and will allow them to improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase small animals.
