loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas, 31, is a smallholder farmer who lives in Chemaner village found in Bomet area of Kenya. He started farming a decade ago in anticipation to support his family which he started when he married 2 years afterwards. Today, his family is composed of him, his wife and 3 children between 1 and 7 years. On his 1 acre farmland, he keeps 1 dairy cow and 10 heads of poultry. He also has two dozen trees within the property. 

Thomas has aspirations of becoming a big poultry farmer. To grow his business, he needs to grow the number of poultry in order to turn significant profit. He is seeking a loan of KES 10,000 to buy a brood of hens. He will generate income from the investment by selling poultry products such as eggs, meat, chicks and cockerels. 

Income from this investment will enable him to uplift his livelihood and support his family financially.

loans.use: to buy poultry to expand his agricultural business and provide a secure future for his family

loans.name: Eloina Adaly

texts.es: Eloina, tiene 44 años de edad, es madre soltera con tres hijos a su cargo, reside con ellos en una aldea del municipio de Pimienta, Cortes. Lleva dos años de generar sus propios ingresos para su familia, vende productos de la canasta básica como ser azúcar, manteca, arroz, pan, huevos, churros, cereales, productos de aseo, condimentos, carnes etc. y también achinería como ropa de niño, lociones y cosméticos para obtener otros ingresos. El préstamo que solicita es por 10,000 para comprar productos alimenticios como granos básicos, productos de limpieza, refrescos, churros, pan, azúcar, etc. y achinería para surtir el negocio y aumentar las ganancias. Su plan es seguir ampliando el negocio para darle educación a sus hijos.
texts.en: Eloina, 44 years old, is a single mother with three children in her care. She lives with them in a suburb of the town of Pimienta, Cortes. For two years, she has been earning her own income for her family selling basic grocery products like sugar, margarine, rice, bread, eggs, churros, cereals, toiletries, condiments, meat, etc. and also items sold door-to-door like children's clothing, lotions and cosmetics to obtain more income. The loan that she is requesting is for 10,000 to buy grocery products like basic grains, cleaning products, sodas, churros, bread, sugar, etc. and household items to stock her business and increase her earnings. Her plan is to keep expanding the business to give her children an education.

loans.use: to buy grocery products like basic grains, cleaning products, sodas, churros, bread, sugar, etc. and household items to stock her business.

As a married parent of three children, Liezel works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food-vending. Liezel is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to  purchase additional fishing nets for her fishing business.

Liezel has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing nets.

loans.name: Belen

texts.en:
Belen is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Belen is 49 years old and has four children who are in school.

Belen has a fishing business in the Philippines. Belen requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other fishing supplies.

Belen has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Belen would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other fishing supplies.

loans.name: Fedgie

texts.en:
Fedgie is 30 years old, married, and has five children, three of whom are in school.

Fedgie is in the agricultural business farming seaweed in the Philippines. Fedgie requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy more seaweed and seaweed materials for her business. Fedgie has been in this business for four years now, and has borrowed once in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Fedgie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more seaweed and seaweed materials for her business

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with five children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines and she is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies. She supplements this income with earnings from pig fattening. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. 

Mary Jane dreams that one day she will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Jose Francisco

texts.es:
José, desea seguir invirtiendo en su negocio para mantener su crecimiento y rentabilidad, solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas y pagar el arrendamiento de la porción de tierra en la que planea cultivar granos básicos, espera seguir manteniendo el buen desarrollo de su negocio.
El resultado de la inversión anterior es muy positivo, sus cosecha aumento, poco a apoco la situación económica está mejorando y continua soltero.
texts.en:
José wants to continue to invest in his business to sustain profitability and growth. He is requesting a new loan to buy agricultural supplies and pay for the lease on the piece of land in which he will grow basic grains. He wants to continue maintaining the smooth development of his business.

The result of the previous investment has been very positive and his harvest increased. Little by little, the economic situation is continuously improving.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and pay the lease on the piece of land in which he plans to grow basic grains.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase materials to implement market stall and products to sell

loans.name: Virigilia

texts.es: VIRIGILIA: Es una señora afable de 47 años, originaria de la comunidad de Koom, es un vocablo miskito que significa primera comunidad de la madre tierra de Rio Coco de Abajo, se localiza a 40 kilómetros del municipio de Waspam-Rio Coco. Trabaja como docente de educación primaria. Con el propósito de brindarle a sus hijos una vivienda segura y digna, solicita financiamiento para iniciar la construcción de su vivienda de Concreto. Con el préstamo va comprar cemento, bloque y hierro. Ella sueña con tener una casa bonita, con mejores condiciones de seguridad y mejor ambiente para  sus hijos.
texts.en:
VIRIGILIA is a 47 year old woman. She is native of the community of Koom which is a Miskito word meaning first community in the Mother Earth of Rio Coco de Abajo. It is located 40 km from the municipality of Waspam-Rio Coco. She works as a Primary school teacher.

With the goal of providing her children with a more dignified and secure house she is requesting a loan to start the construction of a concrete house. She will buy cement, cinder blocks and re-bar with the loan. Her dream i to have a beautiful house with the best conditions of security and best environment for her children.

loans.use: to buy cement, cinder blocks and iron.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: Miguel tiene 22 años de edad, es soltero y labora en mantenimiento de edificaciones (electricista, gasfitero, etc.) es por esto que le gusta su trabajo y decidió empezar a estudiar la carrera de ingeniería civil en una universidad particular donde ya va por el II ciclo y se siente muy contento por el reto que se planteó. Es por esto que el préstamo lo invertirá en comprar una herramienta de estudio (laptop) y para pagar las cuotas de la universidad. Miguel tiene pensado obtener su profesión y empezar a trabajar como ingeniero civil en empresas muy grandes y así de esta forma obtener la experiencia y recursos suficientes para poder formar su propia constructora que tanto anhela. Él se siente muy contento y agradecido con el apoyo y la confianza que está recibiendo por parte de los inversionistas de KIVA y pide que el apoyo continúe con muchos jóvenes como el que lo necesitan.
texts.en:
Miguel is 22 years old. He is single and works maintaining buildings (electrician, plumber, etc.). as he likes his work he decided to study civil engineering in a private university. He is in the second cycle and is very content with the challenge he has set out.

For this reason he will invest the loan in a work tool (laptop) and pay his university fees. Miguel is thinking of getting his degree and starting to work as a civil engineer in very large companies and in this manner obtain the experience and necessary resources to form his own construction company which he wants so much.

He feels very content and grateful with the support and confidence that he is receiving from the Kiva lenders and asks that this support continues for many young people like him who need the help.

loans.use: to buy study tools (a laptop).

loans.name: Alex Manuel

texts.es:
Alex tiene 23 años de edad y es soltero. Vive con sus padres y sus tres hermanos en una casa de material rústico en el distrito de Pucará, provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. La población del distrito se dedica principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

El se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte público, cuenta con una mototaxi propia con la cual brinda este servicio. Cuenta con 02 años de experiencia en el rubro y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. Además también se dedica a realizar labores agrícolas como peón para así obtener ingresos adicionales. El préstamo será utilizado en reparaciones y compra de materiales para el mantenimiento de su unidad móvil, con esto Alex espera mejorar las condiciones en las que brinda el servicio de transporte, satisfaciendo así las necesidades de sus clientes lo que tendrá un gran impacto en su nivel de ingresos y por ende aumentará su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Alex is 23 years old, and single. He lives with his parents and three siblings in a house made of rustic materials in the Pucará District, which is in the Jaén Province, in the Cajamarca Región of Peru's northern sierra. The people of the district mainly work in agriculture, livestock-raising, and commerce. 

He provides public transportation service. He has his own motorcycle taxi with which he provides this service, and he has two years’ experience in this occupation, with very good personal and work references in the zone. He also works in agriculture, as a field hand, in order to earn extra income. 

The loan will be used for repairs and the purchase of materials for the maintenance of his vehicle. With this, Alex hopes to improve the conditions in which he provides the transportation service, thus satisfying his customers’ needs. This will have a great impact on his income level, and as a result, his quality of life will increase.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle and purchase materials for its maintenance.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene works hard to support her family. Irene is married and has a business buying and selling fruits and vegetables in the Philippines.

Irene requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy fruits and vegetables like onions, garlic, mango, apples, etc to sell on her food stall.

Irene has been in this business for 2 years now, and also earns additional income from a general store.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables like onions, garlic, mango, apples, to sell on her food stall.

loans.name: Liliosa

texts.en:
Liliosa is 50 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, Liliosa works very hard to provide for them.

Liliosa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like salts, sugar, personal care products and other groceries.

Liliosa has been in this business for 10 years now. 

In the future, Liliosa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like salts, sugar, personal care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita works hard to support her family. Merlita is married and has a business buying and selling dried fish in the Philippines.

Merlita requested a PHP 9,500 loan through NWTF to buy more dried fish to sell. Merlita has been in this business for seven years now.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is 68 years old and has one child. Juanita is a married woman.

Juanita is in the agricultural business farming fruits in the Philippines. Juanita requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies. Juanita has been in this business for five years now, and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Juanita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilzer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 63 years old and has eleven children, one of whom is still in school. Violeta is married.

Violeta is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Violeta requested a PHP 4,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies. Violeta has been in this business for two years now.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Ma. Bernaditha

texts.en:
Ma. Bernaditha is 65 years old and has nine children, one of whom is in school. Ma. Bernaditha is married.

Ma. Bernaditha is in the agricultural business farming seaweed in the Philippines. Ma. Bernaditha requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy more seaweed and seaweed materials for her business. Ma. Bernaditha has been in this business for 40 years now, and has borrowed once in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Ma. Bernaditha would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more seaweed and seaweed materials for her business

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is a 38-year-old married woman with six children, five of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Marilou has a seaweed business in the Philippines. Marilou requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more seaweed and seaweed materials for her business. Marilou has been in this business for five years. 

In the future, Marilou would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more seaweed and seaweed materials for her business

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is a 53-year-old married woman with three children, one of whom is still in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Leonida has a weaving business in the Philippines. Leonida requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials for her weaving business. Leonida has been in this business for 25 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Juanita

texts.es:
Juanita tiene 25 años de edad, vive junto a su hija en la casa de sus padres en una comunidad rural ubicada en el distrito de Cayalti, los pobladores se dedican al comercio de animales menores y a la agricultura, se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de cuyes y aves de corral, cuenta con experiencia en este negocio y con buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito. Ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales así como para realizar arreglos del lugar donde los cría lo que le permitirá mejorar su distribución y espacio, esto le permitirá mejorar su negocio lo que incrementará su nivel de ingresos y va a mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Juanita is 25 years old. She lives together with her daughter in the house of her parents in a rural community in the district of Cayalti. The inhabitants work in the business of raising small animals and agriculture. It is located in the province of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region, on the North Coast of Peru.

She works raising and selling guinea pigs and poultry. She has experience in the field and good personal and work references in the district. She has requested a loan to buy a greater quality of animals and to fix up the place where she raises them. This will allow her to improve her distribution and space which will allow her to improve her business and increase her level of income. Then she can improve her quality of living and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy a greater number of animals as well as fixing up the place where she keeps them.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with nine children.

She runs a buy-and-sell nipa roofing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional nipa roofing to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures, like a general store and raising pigs.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. 

Rosalinda dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional nipa roofing to sell

loans.name: Kim

texts.en:
Kim is 29 years old and has five children. Kim is married and has three children who are in school.

Kim is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Kim requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Kim has been in this business for 4 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Kim would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Myra Luz

texts.en:
Myra Luz is 35 years old, married, and has five children, four of whom are in school.

Myra Luz is in the agricultural business farming seaweed in the Philippines. Myra Luz requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy needed materials, such as plastic bags. Myra Luz has been in this business for 14 years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Myra Luz would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy needed materials, such as plastic bags

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Lilia is 53 years old and has three children who are in school.

Lilia has a mat weaving business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more materials for her mat weaving business.

Lilia has been in this business for 25 years. In the future, Lilia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her mat weaving business.

loans.name: Gelyn

texts.en:
Gelyn is married and has four children. She works hard to support her family. She sells personal products in the Philippines. She earns additional income from a bakery.  

Gelyn is requesting her sixth loan from NWTF for 15,500 PHP, which she will use to buy additional personal products to sell. She hopes to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional personal products to sell

loans.name: Nellie

texts.en:
Nellie is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 39 years old and has three children who are in school.

Nellie has a buy-and-sell ready-to-wear business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more clothes to sell like pants, shirts, etc..

Nellie has been in this business for three years. 

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell like pants, shirts, etc.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 58 years old, married, and has four children.

She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Edna requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

Edna has been in this business for 25 years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
With children to raise, water to fetch, and food to cook, Sabina has little time to make money to provide financial support for her family. Sabina is a hardworking and honest smallholder farmer who hails from the Nkubu area of Kenya. 

From the wonderful Kiva lenders she is seeking a loan worth 30,000 KES to buy seedlings and grow her horticulture business. 

Horticultural produce and processed products from the developing world are becoming increasingly popular in international markets, evident by the steadily rising exports. While experience shows that horticulture offers good opportunities for poverty reduction because it increases employment and generates income, the government takes little care to ensure that small and poor farmers are not excluded from the opportunities in this market sector. It is against this backdrop that Juhudi has teamed up with Kiva to give Sabina access to a loan that will aid her in growing her horticulture farm into a highly profitable business, increasing employment opportunities and bringing about increasing commercialization of the rural sector. 

With your loan, Sabina’s family will benefit from the growth and diversification of their family business. This will not only increase their income, but also reduce their income vulnerability.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and grow her horticulture farming business.

loans.name: Lyh

texts.en:
Lyh is 44 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Lyh has borrowed and paid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from food vending.

Lyh aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Duena

texts.en:
Duena is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines, and is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

She supplements this income with earnings from her food vending and a general store. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. 

Duena dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 48 years old and has four children. She is married and has two children who are still in school.

Evelyn is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Evelyn has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Jesse

texts.en:
Jesse is a 33 year old farmer from Ndaragwa area of Kenya who is deeply passionate about dairy farming. Since he started farming 3 years ago, he has already acquired 2 high yield dairy cows. His wife- Margaret- and 3 children help Jesse to look after the 2 cows. 

Jesse is seeking a loan to buy another dairy cow. The help he gets from family and the surplus pasture available on his land makes this an easy decision for him. The milk produced by the newly acquired cow will increase the total quantity of milk they supply to the market and increase their family income. 
Having additional income from this investment will help Jesse handle his growing financial obligations towards his family such as food, medical care and school fees.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to increase milk yield and be used to meet family bills, like medical and schooling

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
The story of Evangeline tells us of a 42-year-old mum who works 14 hours every day of the week on her mixed farm in Nkubu area of Kenya. It’s a normal thing to have cereals in Kenya, but to start selling the cereals is something else entirely. 

Evangeline is a smallholder mixed-farmer. She is the mother of four who has been practicing mixed farming for the last 15 years. To earn a decent living, she makes income selling milk, poultry, greens and engaging in numerous small personal businesses. Only recently, she started seeing how she could be making big money off cereal selling. She wants to sell cereals to the ready market that is in her region. However, her biggest challenge today is limited funds to expand. 

Evangeline is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders via Juhudi Kilimo to purchase cereal to sell. 

Future proceeds from the commercialization of her cereal-selling business are already committed to pay for her children's education. 

In the long run, she is confident her efforts will translate into her family having a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy cereals to sell

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is 39 years old. She is a married woman.

Remedios is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Remedios requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

She has been in this business for three years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Remedios would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
As a married parent of ten children, Conchita works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling ready to wear in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from buying and selling vegetables. 

Conchita is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more stock of ready to wear to sell for her business buying and selling ready to wear.

Conchita has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ready to wear to sell

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Elena works hard to support her family.

She has a pig fattening business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from rice retailing.  Elena is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to  buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

Elena has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Fredesbindo

texts.es:
Fredesbindo vive junto a su esposa e hija en el Distrito de Zaña, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la venta de alimentos preparados y servicios recreativos, adicionalmente se dedica a la crianza de ganado lechero, cuyes, siembra de caña y alfalfa. Ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de una mayor cantidad de ganado para incrementar su negocio, con esto el espera obtener ingresos mayores que le permitirán mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Fredesbindo lives with his wife and daughter in the Zaña district.  This is a community devoted to farming, trade, and livestock production.  It is located in Chiclayo province in the Lambayeque region of the northern coast of Peru.

Fredesbindo has a business selling prepared foods and recreational services.  He also raises livestock, including dairy cows and guinea pigs, and he cultivates sugar cane and alfalfa.  He has requested a loan to buy a greater quantity of cattle to expand his business.  This way, he hopes to increase his income so that he will be able to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Nayme

texts.en:
Nayme is 31 years old, married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to buy additional household goods to sell.

Nayme has borrowed and paid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from weaving bamboo and raising pigs.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. 

Nayme aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional household goods to sell and secure the future for herself and her children

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines and is borrowing PHP 19000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She supplements this income with earnings from her poultry. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. 

Marites dreams that one day  will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies so as to build and expand her business to help her family

loans.name: Nergie

texts.en:
Nergie is 60 years old and has ten children. Nergie is married and has one child is still in school.

Nergie is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Nergie requested a PHP 29000 loan through NWTF to buy more seeds and fertilizer.

Nergie has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more seeds and fertilizer, to save money for her business

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Violeta is 41 years old and has  children who are in school.

Violeta has a buy and sell ready to wear business in the Philippines. Violeta requested a PHP 27500 loan amount through NWTF to buy more clothes to sell in her business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Violeta has been in this business for 21 years. In the future, Violeta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional bundles of used clothing to sell and to save money in order to expand her business further

loans.name: Shirly

texts.en:
Shirly is 35 years old and married and she has five children, four of whom are in school. 

Shirly is in the agricultural business farming rice in the Philippines. 

Shirly requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies. She has been in this business for four years now, and she has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Shirly would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilzer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad is 58 years old and married with two children.

Trinidad works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 28000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries like canned goods, noodles, shampoo and other groceries.

Trinidad has borrowed and paid 28 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for twenty years and also earns an income from food vending.

Trinidad aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries like canned goods, noodles, shampoo and other groceries.

loans.name: Sherryl

texts.en:
Sherryl is 39 years old and married with two children. Two of her children are still in school, and Sherryl works very hard to provide for them.

Sherryl runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, spices, coffee, noodles, and other groceries.

Sherryl has been in this business for 15 years.

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, spices, coffee, noodles, and other groceries

loans.name: Victoriana

texts.en:
Victoriana is 56 years old and has 15 children. She is married and 4 of her children are in school.

Victoriana is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock. She has been in this business for 4 years now, and, in order to help sustain it, she has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF.

In the future, Victoriana would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Carolina Lisset

texts.es:
Carolina, tiene una venta de ropa, sandalias y chancletas, es casada, vive con sus hijos y su esposo, su negocio lo abrió hace varios años, lo trabaja de manera ambulante en diferentes caseríos y cantones aledaños a la localidad en donde habita.
Invertirá en ropa para niños/as, adultos, sandalias y chancletas para ambos sexos, ofrecerá mejores productos a sus clientes, esperando que las ventas continúen creciendo para que los ingresos mejoren.
Sus aspiraciones son mantener su fuente de ingresos activa para reducir sus deudas, cubrir los gastos que tiene su familia y lo más importante poder darles a sus hijos educación de calidad para que puedan tener un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Carolina sells clothing, sandals, and flip-flops. She’s married, and she lives with her children and her husband. She opened her business several years ago. She works on foot in different villages and cantons that adjoin the town where she lives.

She will invest in clothing for girls, boys, and adults, and sandals and flip-flops for both sexes. She will offer her customers better products, hoping that the sales may continue growing so that her income may improve. 

Her aspirations are: to keep her income source active in order to reduce her debts, to cover her family’s expenses, and, most important of all, to be able to give her children a quality education so that they can have a better future.

loans.use: to invest in clothing for boys, girls, and adults; sandals and flip-flops for both sexes; and to offer better products to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in galvanized steel, wood, and nails to  build a ceiling over the laundry room and water storage area in order to prevent nesting insects.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 40 years old and married with four children, three of which attend school.  For 10 years she has operated an agricultural business farming seaweed in the Philippines. 

Rosalie requested a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more seaweed and seaweed materials for her business.  She has borrowed 1 time in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Rosalie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more seaweed and seaweed materials for her business.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Mary Jane works hard to support her family.  She has a buy-and-sell dried fish business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buy and sell vegetables and general store.  

Mary Jane is borrowing PHP 25000 through NWTF to  purchase more boxes of dried fish to sell in her food stall for her dried fish business.

Mary Jane has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy dried fish

loans.name: Relen

texts.en:
Relen is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Relen is 49 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Relen has a buy-and-sell vegetables business in the Philippines. Relen requested a PHP 14500 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Relen has been in this business for 15 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy vegetables

loans.name: Erma

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Erma works hard to support her family.  She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. 

Erma is borrowing PHP 7000 through NWTF to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies for her fishing business.  She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

Erma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy fishing supplies

loans.name: Novelline

texts.en:
Novelline is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Novelline is 38 years old and all her seven children are currently in school.

Novelline has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 17000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business such as meat, fish, chicken, spices, cooking oil and other utensils.

Novelline has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients

loans.name: Virgenia

texts.en:
Virgenia is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Virgenia is 56 years old now.

Virgenia has a mat weaving business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more materials for her mat weaving business.

Virgenia has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Virgenia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: buy mat weaving materials

loans.name: Lucelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of one children, Lucelyn works hard to support her family.

Lycelyn has a pig fattening business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store.  She is borrowing PHP 19000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Lucelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy pig feed & supplies

loans.name: Mimelyn

texts.en:
Mimelyn works hard to support her family. Mimelyn is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Mimelyn requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fishing materials for her business.  She has been in this business for 10 years now.  She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy fishing supplies

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a persistent and hardworking woman who takes advantage of her farming skills to generate an income. She is a hardworking mom and aggressive with the principle of truth on her lips. She is honest and faithful to what she does and what she says. 

Elizabeth has been practicing mixed farming for the past thirty three years. She is seeking a loan to buy seedlings and expand her horticulture farm. She is very hardworking and determined to increase her farm's output. Loans for smallholder farmers with little, irregular income and no solid collateral are hard to come by in Kenya. A few organizations such as Juhudi Kilimo support farmers like Elizabeth. Through a group of 15 members called Lumboka self-help group, Elizabeth has access to income-generating asset loans from Juhudi, which uses the group-based savings as collateral. 

According to Juhudi Kilimo, horticulture represents an opportunity for reducing poverty through income generation among smallholders, whether unskilled or semi-skilled. In the past, African women used to stay at home and look after the household. 

Juhudi Kilimo facilitates loans that empower smallholder farmers like Elizabeth, because the institution believes that women, too, are actively involved in various segments of the horticultural industry.

loans.use: buy seedlings

loans.name: Minata's Group

texts.fr: Minata qui se trouve sur la photo portant un foulard  multicolore ( jaune et bleu ) à gauche et tenant la pochete de myAgro, est membre d’un groupe de 8  agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Falan au sud de Bamako au Mali. Minata, âgée de 73 ans, est la mère de 3 enfants âgés de 15 à 53 ans, dont 2 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés. L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer a incité Minata à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 60 ans. Minata cultive l'arachide, le maraichage sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie, de matériels agricoles et d'engrais de qualité. Minata entame sa troisième année avec myAgro, et s'est réinscrite en raison de la perspective de pouvoir augmenter son rendement à travers les services proposés par myAgro et de l'avis favorable de son entourage sur l'impact positif de myAgro, ainsi que de l'image positive de myAgro dans les villages avoisinants. Cette année Minata effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.25 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 60 ans que Minata cultive l'arachide pour sa valeur commerciale, car l’arachide est un aliment qu’elle vend sur le marché et aussi pour sa rentabilité productive et marchande. Minata planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  d'étendre la surface cultivée et d'acheter du matériel agricole  . Enfin Minata espère aussi pouvoir assurer l'autosuffisance alimentaire de la famille.
texts.en:
Minata , who is wearing a multicolored ( yellow and blue headscarf) in the photo, the one on the left holding a myAgro booklet, belongs to a group of eight farmers signed up with myAgro. They all live in work in the village of Falan, to the south of Bamako in Mali. Minata, 73 years old, is the mother of three children ranging from 15 to 53 years of age, two of whom are still in school. Her family has been traditionally engaged in farm work, which is the main source of income and food for the household. This is why Minata too has been doing farm work for 60 years already. 

Minata is starting her third year with myAgro. She renewed her membership in the hope of being able to increase her yield thanks to the services offered by myAgro and the favorable opinion of her friends and family on the impact of myAgro, as well as the positive image enjoyed by myAgro in the nearby villages. This year Minata is making payments on a package of myAgro seeds needed to grow peanuts and increase the crop yield on her field of 0.25 ha [0.6 acres].    Minata has been growing peanuts for 60 years now because of their commercial value as she sells peanuts at the market and earns a profit. Thanks to a higher yield and increased revenue, Minata anticipates expanding her field and buying agricultural supplies. She also hopes to be able to ensure that her family always has sufficient food.

loans.use: to buy peanuts seed to increase her crop yield.

loans.name: Xejuyup 3 Group

texts.es:
Manuela es una mujer de 40 años de edad, es soltera vive junto a sus cinco hijos de las edades entre 5 y 18 años en una comunidad de Sololá.
Manuela (la primera del lado izquierdo de la fotografía de blusa blanca) con el afán de generar sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia se dedica a la venta de café, esta labor lo realiza ella desde hace ocho años.
Manuela es una mujer muy trabajadora es por eso que ahora se encuentra muy  preocupada porque su cultivo de café ya necesita de su mantenimiento y ella no cuenta con el capital suficiente para poder comprar sus fertilizantes y pago de mano de obra, por tal razón junto a un grupo de personas solicita un préstamo para poder sacar adelante a su cultivo.
El gran sueño de manuela es poder ver a sus hijos ser grandes profesionales.
texts.en:
Manuela is a 40 year-old woman who is single.  She lives with her 5 children between the ages of 5 and 18 years in the community of Solola.  With the desire to generate income and provide for her family, Manuela, (the first on the left in the photo,wearing a white blouse), produces coffee.  She's been doing this work for 8 years.

Manuela is a very hardworking woman who is now very concerned because her coffee crops need maintenance and she does not have the funds she needs to buy fertilizers and to pay for labor.  This is why she got this group together to request a loan so that she can take care of her crops.

Manuela's greatest dream is to be able to see her children become great professionals.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizers and labor for her coffee crops

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Juvy works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pedicure. Juvy is borrowing PHP 17000 through NWTF in order to buy more sea foods to sell for her fish vending business.

Juvy has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more sea food to sell so that she can send her children to school

loans.name: Naty

texts.en:
Naty is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Naty is 28 years old and has one child in school.

Naty has a bakery business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like sugar, etc. to use in her business.

Naty has been in this business for 7 years. In the future, Naty would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like sugar, etc. to use in her business

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy additional fishing net, gasoline, bamboo, etc for her fishing business.

Lucia has been in this business for 26 years. Lucia earns more income from buy and sell fish.

Lucia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college  in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing net, gasoline, bamboo, etc so as to raise money for her kids college education

loans.name: Rena

texts.en:
Rena works hard to support her family. Rena is married and has a rice retelling business in the Philippines.

Rena requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to purchase more sacks of rice to sell.

Rena has been in this business for 5 years now.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Negociantes Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está conformado por 3 mujeres (CRISTINA, MARIA ESTER y REYNA NOHEMI) todas son de la etnia miskita de la ciudad de Bilwi, municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Son mujeres emprendedoras que luchan día a día por hacer crecer sus pequeños negocios de venta de granos básicos, verduras y ropa usada. Se organizaron como grupo solidario desde hace 9 meses, para gestionar préstamos con garantía solidaria en Pana Pana.  Con el primer crédito otorgado por PANA PANA y financiado por KIVA, le permitieron a las integrantes incrementar sus inventarios, por ejemplo a REYNA NOHEMI, surtió su negocio con frutas, verduras, queso, cuajadas, frijoles cosidos.

CRISTINA: Es integrante del grupo solidario “NEGOCIANTES”, es una mujer amable de 55 años de edad, madre soltera de 4 hijos: 3 Son mayores de edad y el menor de 17 años, no estudia porque tiene problemas psicomotores. Con el propósito de sacar adelante a sus hijos, desde hace más de tres décadas estableció su pequeña pulpería en un tramo de madera que alquila, pagando una mensualidad de C$100 (Cien Córdobas Netos). Esta solicitando financiamiento para comprar chiverías, granos básicos, gaseosas, entre otros productos. Ella sueña con tener un negocio prospero.
texts.en:
This communal bank is made up of 3 women: Cristina, Maria Ester, and Reyna Nohemi.  They are all of Miskita ethnicit and are from the city of Bilwi, in the municipality of Puerto Cabezas.  These are enterprising women who struggle each day to grow their small businesses. They sell consumer staples, vegetables, and second-hand clothing.  They formed a communal bank 9 months ago to obtain loans with a group guarantee from Pana Pana.  With their first loan from Pana Pana, financed through Kiva, they were able to increase their inventories.  For example, Reyna Nohemi was able to stock up her business with fruits, vegetables, cheese, curds, and cooked beans.

Cristina is a member of this group, called "Negociantes."  She is a friendly 55 year-old woman who is a single mother with 4 children.  Three of her children are grown, and the youngest is 17 years old but does not study because he has psychomotor problems.  With the goal of providing for her children, she has had a small grocery store for more than 3 decades.  She sells from a wooden stall that she rents, paying a monthly sum of 100 Nicaraguan cordobas.  With this loan, she will buy snacks, consumer staples, soft drinks, and other products.  Cristina dreams of having a prosperous business.

loans.use: to buy products for her store

loans.name: Visitacion

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Visitacion works hard to support her family.

She has a raising pigs business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buy and sell firewood.  Visitacion is borrowing PHP 14000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock for her raising pigs business.

Visitacion has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock and save money for the future

loans.name: Mimi

texts.en:
Mimi is 31 years old and has three children.  She is married and two of her children are in school.

Mimi is in the agricultural business farming vegetable in the Philippines.  She requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies.
 
Mimi has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.  In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy fertilzers & farm supplies

loans.name: Pilar

texts.en:
Pilar is 32 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, Pilar works very hard to provide for them.

Pilar runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, eggs, personal product care and other groceries.

Pilar has been in this business for 3 years now. 

In the future, Pilar would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, eggs, personal product care and other groceries

loans.name: Rogerita

texts.en:
Rogerita is married with six children, two in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like canned goods, egg, milk, and sugar.

Rogerita has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 18 years and also earns an income from fishing.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, and sugar.

loans.name: Ma. Evilyn

texts.en:
Ma. Evilyn is 39 years old and married with five children, four in school. Ma. Evilyn works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Evilyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home care products and other groceries.

Ma. Evilyn has been in this business for 10 years now. 

In the future, Ma. Evilyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home care products and other groceries

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to buy more seafood to sell to customers.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting this new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Rosario's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell.

loans.name: May

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, May works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines and earns additional income from buying and selling bananas.  May is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy sacks of charcoal to sell.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested this loan to further build her businesses. 

May has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to sell for her business

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en: Dorcas is a 48-year-old mother. She has been running a small-scale mixed farm in Kenya for 25 years. Her primary income sources are maize, vegetables, and profits from a small-time personal business. Dorcas is seeking a loan to purchase modern farming implements. She realized that she is working increasingly longer and harder on her farm. The farm work women in the area are currently doing was previously done by males. Women have been forced to take over as their husbands migrate to find wage labor in urban areas. Therefore, the tools women use are of great importance for improving productivity and yields, and reducing time and physical effort. There are health implications as well from using poor traditional tools. The increased income from the use of better tools will help her meet business-related expenses. When asked, 'How will this loan benefit your family?' Dorcas replied, "I will be able to educate my children."

loans.use: To buy modern farming implements

loans.name: Arceline

texts.en:
Arceline is a married mother of 7 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 45 years old and 6 of her children are in school.

Arceline has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a 5,000 PHP loan amount through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Arceline has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda is 32 years old, has two children and she works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling dried fish. Glenda is borrowing 14,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fishing materials like fishing net, gasoline, wood, etc., for her fishing business.

Glenda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like fishing net, gasoline, wood, etc.

loans.name: Mujeres Del Sector Xesuj Group

texts.es:
Petronila es una mujer de 30 años de edad, es casada tiene una linda familia de dos hijos de las edades entre 2 y 6 años, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Petronila (es la que se encuentra en medio de la fotografía de blusa celeste) es una mujer muy responsable y dedicada a la familia que para generar sus ingresos y sacarlos adelante trabaja en la agricultura, ella tiene 10 años de trabajar en el campo.
Petronila por ser una mujer de mucho liderazgo a organizado a un grupo de personas, para juntos solicitar un crédito  que lo invertirá en la compra de sus fertilizantes para el mantenimiento de café.
El gran sueño de Petronila es construir una casa para heredarlo a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Petronila is a 30-year-old woman. She is married and has a lovely family of two children who are 2 and 6 years old. This humble family lives in a community in Sololá.

Petronila (she is the one who can be found in the middle of the photograph in the light blue blouse) is a woman who is very responsible and dedicated to her family. To make an income and bring her family out ahead she works in agriculture. She has worked in the field for 10 years.

Because Petrolina is a woman with many leadership skills, she has organized a group of people to request a loan together, which she will invest in the purchase of fertilizers to maintain her coffee crops.

Petronila’s greatest dream is to construct a home to leave to her children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Febe Ann

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Febe Ann works hard to support her family.

She has a fruit-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Febe Ann is borrowing 16,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Febe Ann has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 39 years old and married with two children. Marites works very hard to provide for her family.

Marites runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, personal care products and other groceries.

Marites has been in this business for five years now. 

In the future, Marites would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, personal care products and other groceries

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is 49 years old, and married with six children.  She works hard to provide for her family by operating a general store in the Philippines.  She has operated this general store for 20 years, and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Jean requested a 9,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.  She has borrowed and repaid 1 loan from NWTF prior to this loan.

Jean aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Constancia

texts.en:
Constancia is a married woman with nine children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Constancia is 59 years old now.

Constancia has an abaca (fiber from the abaca palm leaf is used for handicraft production) weaving business in the Philippines. She requested a 5,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy abaca fiber, etc.

Constancia has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Constancia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy abaca fiber, etc.

loans.name: Ascion

texts.en:
Ascion works hard to support her family. Ascion is married and has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines.

She requested a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of vegetables to sell.

Ascion has been in this business for 4 years now. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. 

In the future, Ascion would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Grupo Agrícola Patzite Costa Group

texts.es:
Alonzo es un padre de familia de 50 años de edad, es casado tiene una linda familia de cinco hijos de las edades entre 19 y 35 años, está linda familia vive en una comunidad de patzite.
Alonzo (el primero del lado izquierdo de la fotografía) con el afán de obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia se dedica  a la venta de café, esta actividad lo realiza el desde hace diez años.
Alonzo ahora junto a un grupo de personas está solicitando un crédito para poder darle mantenimiento a su cultivo de café pues ahora el cultivo ya necesita de sus fertilizantes y pago de la mano de obra y él no cuenta con el capital suficiente.
El gran sueño de Alonzo es poder contar con este crédito para poder  aumentar su cultivo.
texts.en:
Alonzo is a father who is 50 years old. He is married and has a beautiful family of five children, aged from 19 to 35 years old. This beautiful family lives in a community of Patzite.

Alonzo (the first standing on the left in the photograph) in an effort to obtain income and raise his family, makes a living selling coffee. This is an activity he has been doing for the last 10 years.

Now Alonzo together with a group of people is asking for a loan so that he can maintain his coffee crop cultivation. Now it is necessary to buy fertilizers and pay for manual labor, but he does not have sufficient capital.

Alonzo's big dream is that he can have this loan so that he can continue to increase his crop.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for manual labor.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina is a smallholder farmer from Muthara village in Kenya who raises goats, cows and poultry on a four acre property. Sabina lives with her husband and six children. Five of her children are in boarding schools.

Sabina has been farming for as long as she has been married - 15 years. Her main source of income is milk, poultry and a variety of food crops. 

Sabina is seeking a loan of 20,000 KES to buy a water tank. Her farm is situated near a river where she gets her water. Having a water tank will help her irrigate her land more easily and effectively. The tank will also ensure constant availability of drinking water for her farm animals. 

With your investment, Sabina's family will enjoy having greener grass and crops, and healthier animals.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard, 56, is a smallholder farmer from Sambirmbir village in the Kapsowar area of Kenya. He enjoys dairy farming and aspires to grow his business and status as a dairy farmer. His children have been groomed into dairy farming and he is confident they will carry on with the practice in the future. 

Richard is seeking a loan to buy a dairy cow. The cow he has identified is a high-quality one that will produce a lot of milk and whose calves will inherit desirable qualities of a high breed. He will also use part of the loan to insure the cow, to cover uncertainties during the repayment term. 

Your loan will push Richard closer to his dreams and uplift his family's livelihood.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Dionesia

texts.en:
Dionesia is a widowed woman with 4 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 58 years old now.

Dionesia has an abacá (or Manila hemp) weaving business in the Philippines, and she has requested a 10,000 PHP loan amount through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to buy abacá fiber and other supplies.

Dionesia has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business so she can secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy abacá fiber and other supplies

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is a hardworking entrepreneur with 6 children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines, and she is borrowing 15,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Elma supplements this income with earnings from pig fattening. She has successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another to further build her businesses. 

Elma dreams that one day she will be able to build and expand her business so she can secure the future of her family

loans.use: to buy fertilzer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is a married mother of 5 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 54 years old, and 4 of her children are in school.

Lucia has an abacá (or Manila hemp) weaving business in the Philippines, and she has requested a 5,000 PHP loan amount through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to purchase abacá fiber and other supplies.

Lucia has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, she would like to save enough to be able to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase abacá fiber and other supplies

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Rosalie works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell vegetables business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from buy-and-sell dried fish and vegetables. Rosalie is borrowing PHP 12,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall for her buy-and-sell vegetables business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. 

Rosalie has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.
